uL_r7cZhHd4arKHo37Tv0A.text: I'm really hard on bbq joints, but I have no complaints about Sin City Smokers. It starts from the moment you walk in. The staff is exceptionally friendly and they take the time to explain the menu if you need help. This was my fourth time there, and the service and quality of food remains consistent. I've had the ribs before and they were very good. I thought they were a little pricey, but that is very common for ribs. On my last visit, I had the brisket.  It was very flavorful, tender, moist, and the serving size was perfect. For sides we had, Mac & cheese, beans, and potato salad. I enjoyed them all. I've read complaints from others about serving size of the sides, but I thought they were the perfect amounts. The fact that this place is close to my house makes it all the better. I'm a fan for sure.

Darix3N8sxRlAT4iQbn78Q.text: Good food. The BLT and the pulled pork were excellent. The potato salad was great and the  slaw but I preferred the potato salad.  My only complaint is I wish the sides were bigger and that you got extra of the roasted jalapenos with the food

Then we both tried to get a refill on our sweet tea and they told us they just threw out all the tea and they did not have anymore. We would of had to purchase another drink if we wanted something else to drink! We go here a lot but will not be back! I guess they don't care about loosing customers!

PuUZwIB8r8PdngEwGWlWdg.text: Food is really good.  Some things are quite overpriced.... we were charged $7.99 for a plain cheese quesadilla for a child. I asked if it had to be baby back ribs, and the dark-haired girl running the register told me I could get spare or baby back.... but failed to mention spare ribs was $9 MORE.  I get that they are bigger, but you should mention that there is a huge price difference, especially when I clearly asked about the special. I didn't get a very friendly vibe from her in general.

nM4gVRFS6yAYnsj5CyDoZg.text: Amazing BBQ!!!  A new go to for great food!  Staff was friendly. We will definitely be coming back.

gNFhAzDOPf3LvV3q98QzSg.text: Wow just wow, good quality! The meat is amazing! Ribs are incredible! Brisket and mac a Roni and chees is marvelous! I will be back! A must!  Brittney is incredibly nice and a fantastic server!! Must eat here, it is a hidden Gem!

h7b2A2ALDVV0443Wa8Vb1w.text: Outstanding!  BBQ doesn't get any better than this!  Have been going since they opened...and it is over a 10 mile drive to do that.  worth every mile.  I still can't make it through the entire menu because I can't get past the brisket.  The best I have ever had...and I have had all over the country.  The ribs are great, I love the chicken, on Sundays they do a Brunswick Stew...great.  But mostly I still can't get past the brisket because you can't get anything like it anywhere else.  My wife likes the lean brisket, I like the fatty cut.  They do both better than anybody anywhere.  This guy understands meat!

csA84lpwffx0WJQxUWN2_w.text: This place would easily be a 4-5 star BBQ joint if it wasn't for the sides. They tasted alright but the portions were just stupid.  They basically force you to upgrade to the larger sizes and extract more money. Okay, I get it. So, we ordered the largest coleslaw available and it wasn't even filled to the top.  C'mon, it's just cabbage with watered down mayo and some seasoning. If you make me pay extra, at least fill it to the top. The other sides weren't any better in that regard.  Also, skip the sandwiches. There's a lot of lonely bread; the meat was really skimpy for the price. Basically, a ripoff.  That was the problem. The food was good, staff friendly, atmosphere fun, but we felt like we got ripped off in some way.

q2_YZeHb-sqoemTpxhNp5Q.text: They catered my nieces UNLV graduation and did a phenomenal job.  Very professional staff and service from beginning to end.  The food was incredible!!!!! i8dS4OsLiyAYQd8YnBPRlw.text: We came by today which is a Friday so I had the baby back special. My wife and friend both got the BBQ chicken. Far as the meats, my ribs were good but not $15 good and they both felt the portion on the chicken was lacking, along the anything special on taste for the price. The sides were small too. Use to normally getting loaded at BBQ joints with sides or at least bread but here not the case. Only drink options are in a fridge or lemonade/tea is prepared. Have to say, if you do go by, have to try their banana pudding! Now that was delish! Overall for Spending $50 for 3 people to eat, I'm disappointed. Had high hopes for this place based on help reviews but maybe we came on an off day or time.  Also, not family friendly at all. Well those with small children. I have a almost two year old, yet no high chairs were seen nor ever offered so it forced my wife to have to hang onto him. Active little boy! Also no changing tables in bathroom. All in all, try it out for yourself. I've had better for less/more but probably not the worse spot I've ate BBQ at lol

w552-GzgtUnlvVDDpfi9QQ.text: This place has been right under my nose for awhile and I didn't know about it! Thank goodness it was ROTD a couple weeks ago. It's just across the street from the Trader Joe's a shop at a few times a week! Hubby was at home with the kiddo and I said I'd bring home lunch. He was up for anything and I was craving BBQ, as always. I got some loaded fries for myself, tacos for him, some ribs and a free side thanks to my Yelp check-in.   The way the menu is set up is pretty cool. They list all their meats, which you can get as a sandwich. And next to that are other ways to get them - as loaded fries, as tacos, etc. every day of the week is a different special - I remember one day is tamales. You can also buy meat by the pound, do a combo plate and pick out sides and desserts.   I was completely in love with my loaded fries! The fries themselves were done well. And then they were topped with cheese, baked beans, corn salsa and choice of meat - I went with brisket. There were HUGE chunks of tender brisket all over these fries! The meat was so good that it could definitely stand on its own. The corn salsa and baked beans were great additions, too! I'm not usually a fan of beans, but these had so much flavor and were so sweet that I couldn't get enough!  The taco plate comes with two tacos. Hubby had one Pulled pork and one chicken and said he enjoyed both. Part of me wishes I'd gotten to try them myself, but I was happily stuffing those fries in my face...  The Ribs were some of the best I've found here in Vegas. They probably come in second. They had quite a chewy and flavorful bark and the meat was tender enough to pull off the bone.   For my side I chose the dill slaw. It was decent, but nothing compared to my love affair with everything else. And it certainly had a strong dill flavor.   The desserts I'm in the fridge looked good and I might have to try one next time. I can't wait until then!

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/4 rack of ribs
Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy Fries! Cheese, beans (very sweet), corn salsa and your choice of meat - I chose brisket!
Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tacos - one pork and one chicken. Hubby loved them!

Jqm1TEhtv1jWmbAlAX2quw.text: Guys I'm not a bbq fan at all, but this bbq is hands down the best I've ever had. We got the brisket in tacos and the bad a fries with pork. Then for sides we had the jalapeno potato salad and the macaroni cheese. Writing this review is even making my mouth water. The tacos were so good! There's a corn salsa and creamy hot sauce on the tacos. The brisket we had just melted in your mouth, so flavorful. The fries were to die for and you easily share with someone. All the toppings are placed on top of the fries, kind of like a nacho style. The potato salad with the jalapeno was just enough to give a kick but not a lot to where your tongue is going to fall off. There's a nice crunch to it with the jalapeno too! Now let's talk about the Mac and cheese. Wow. They call it the smack and cheese. Homemade deliciousness. Definitely getting it again. If you're in town needing good bbq this is the place to go. So friendly and makes you proud to be an American.

allNQgXcBO7IG7PKvegjAg.text: Hands-down no question the best brisket I've ever tasted in my life. I try and take everybody here that comes to town. The chef is a vegetarian and put out some of the best Q you'll ever taste in your life. The pricing is amazing the quality is doubly amazing and the flavor is off the chart.I drive 17 miles just to go there one way.

JQdl59YB6iWKTtjqx7lN9Q.text: I LOVE Sin City Smokers!  I have eaten at the restaurant a few times and was coming into town for my wedding.  Pitmaster Steve was extremely helpful in setting up a menu to satisfy our guests, even going so far as preparing our special request of bacon wrapped dates which were delicious.  We were throwing a 90 person event so it's a lot to handle but Steve has a lot of catering experience.  They had 4 people on site handling the food and all of my guests commented that the food was absolutely first class!  It's a full service arrangement which includes serving the food, cleaning up their area, and packing up all of the leftovers.  I would work with Sin City Smokers in a heartbeat for any event, they set the standard for BBQ and Catering!  Thank you!

z7S63cqrvGqLOIx3tCDcMg.text: The BEST Bbq in Las Vegas, the cat fish is ranked right up there with my moms and I'm originally from Mississippi and I was raised on catfish. This place knows how to make a great southern catfish, coleslaw and the hush puppies are the bomb.  You are truly missing out if you don't try this out.

aNNHEKSHOZXwQhjiOdXSqg.text: Everything in my life could be summed up with "I should've gotten the fries" I should've, you should too. Or tacos, anything besides 1 meat and some onions and peppers because when they brought it out I was so sad, the menu said hot links as in plural - more than one but I'm pretty sure it was only one albeit a delicious hot link I was still really hungry. Someone ordered the fries and I wanted them because they're massive compared to my little one link and some onions... the sides left some stuff to be desired, their Mac n cheese wasn't anything to write home about and I took one bite and didn't eat any more, too dry for me and not enough cheese but to each their own.   The staff was super friendly and attentive so if I do come back I'm getting the fries!

szGfVTWgco9PgHSlCVU9xw.text: Get there early! They were out of chicken and pulled pork. I had the 2 meat plate of brisket and ribs with 1 side of creamy dill coleslaw. It was great. Husband had the daily special of Brunswick stew. If you like meat this was a great choice. He also had a side of coleslaw and beans. Great food, friendly service. Will definitely be back!

bW-6zBJqVzUfizyj-RXdzw.text: Steve and his team make amazing food!  They did drop off catering for our wedding reception and it was perfect.  They were very responsive and patient with questions we had and any changes to the menu in the time leading up to the event.  The food itself was soo good!  The brisket and the mac & cheese were the crowd favorites, but it was all greatly enjoyed!  I loved the corn salad! We had some guests from in town and they all wanted to know where it was from so they could enjoy it again.  The next day we had friends that came back over to enjoy some leftovers for lunch.  We will definitely be back to eat next time we're in town!  Thanks so much for helping to make our wedding so enjoyable!

xGH84dfEHOVG15lfCjDTvw.text: I am not sure what this place is doing in a downtrodden strip mall, but all i can say is ONE word.... Beef Brisket!  I normally dread going to a BBQ restaurant as it is really 50/50 with the quality of the brisket. I would say most of the places, it is very dry.  The services is great, you walk in, you tell them what you want, pay for it and sit and wait.    The decor is not bad, the seating is okay, but the service and food are excellent.  They have beer and wine as well.  GK says, pork out here on the beef brisket. You will find the melt in your mouth flavors are wonderful.  Check it out.

FRbg-eUqoEZtjWD_3jZv2A.text: We stopped in for lunch this Thursday.  I got the special Big Daddy Mac and my wife got the smoked pork salad.  Both were excellent and big enough to save half for lunch tomorrow too!  We will be back.  I think next time we will get the 5 meat platter to try everything and eat for days.

y13cJ23rGJtdaJyVv15N_A.text: Great news to have a new BBQ place within walking distance of my home. I loves me some 'cue!  Located at the intersection of Sunset and Green Valley Pkwy, in the NW corner shopping center. You walk in past all the trophies of owner Steve's competitive BBQ'g days up to the counter. Choice of meats, of how you want them (tacos, plate, sandwich, quesadilla, etc) and your sides ($2 each). They have a section of weekly specials and signature sandwiches as well.  I went with the 1/2 lb Brisket, with Maple Bacon sweet baked beans and 5 cheese Smack-A-Roni. All in, $20+. Sides are a bit small so recommend a double order. Brisket was nice and moist, with good flavor. The baked beans are almost the same recipe as my own, heavy on the maple and bacon flavor....delicious!!! Smack-a-Roni is good too, creamy with a couple cheez-its on top.   Overall, the place is nicely decorated and clean. Service is good and friendly. Food is very tasty. I'll be back a lot I think, as I enjoy good BBQ. And I think they will get better as they work out all the kinks and get everything working perfectly. They only opened 5 days ago on 1/24, and sold out Friday night.  Hours are 10am-8pm 7 days a week. Not sure why but they have a catering page on Yelp as well with a few reviews, kind of confusing which page is which.

4OvGCzIhIGpyy-Wlrvuzog.text: Incredible value for the money in my books. The beef brisket is so tender and flavourful - wife doesn't like beef much and she enjoyed it very much. Ribs are very tender - we had a tougher pork side rib end but even the meat on these fell off with minimal effort. Chicken was tender but a little spicy for my wife. The sides were good - albeit a little small - I would have doubled my $2 order per side had I known.   Desserts were interesting - though not spectacular. Ate in once and took out another time. I'll be back.

t7nhD--_D_BoajamuDV8Pw.text: BEST. BBQ. IN. VEGAS!!!  This was our first time here, we've lived in Texas, Alabama, and Carolina.... so.... we know our BBQ and love it.  We've been looking for good BBQ in Vegas for almost 3 years, and this place is the best; hands down.  It could even give some places in the south a run for their money... check it out.

M0a4Cp4h0rpKCTzAuQb35g.text: I was really excited to try this place out. It's a cute place and staff was friendly. The brisket was the worst I've had, it was fatty, mushy and had zero smoke flavor. Brisket should not be a pile of mush. The beans were incredibly sweet with no mustard to balance...just sweet, sickening sweet. The mac & cheese was completely tasteless, it literally had zero flavor. I couldn't eat my food, it was really just bad. As I left I passed two men who I assumed were owners, they didn't even acknowledge me or ask how it was. I give this place 6 months before they go out of business.

ZxNzA2OsaFAwukIwcFsyvQ.text: We used Sin City to cater a company party with 100+ employees and they did a fantastic job. I was not on site but worked with them to coordinate everything. On the day of the event they called to confirm, arrived on time, served while they were there and everyone loved the food. I would recommend them and use them again.

Nc5S3yjKDXuKteKbgZHYNQ.text: Yum!! The two of us ordered the big daddy sampler platter and a couple extra sides. Everything we had was incredible. The ribs were fall-off-the-bone. The brisket was so tender. We loved the sides just as much as the meat: dill coleslaw, jalapeno potato salad, mac and cheese and beans. So good!

d-iIScx1WcFix2qfSPWb_w.text: Great food! Great service! I will definitely be back soon. The staff clearly has a passion for excellence and it shows in both the food and the overall hospitality.

zQKNAhONPobMl7af3tmPDQ.text: I ate here with my boyfriend yesterday and the food was great and affordable! We had the sausage and the beef brisket, both were wonderful. This will probably be my go-to for BBQ from now on. I also really like the atmosphere... I mean, it's casual, but it's well decorated and I enjoyed looking around at all the stuff on the walls.

aIpFAbLUqri9KuA0i6901w.text: What's the phrase? Fool me once, shame on me. Fool me twice, shame on you. I always try something at least twice, I believe everyone deserves a fair chance.   This place was a one star experience on BOTH visits. First was a lackluster dine in experience where a sandwich consisted of white toast, a small scoop of meat (of which half was fat and gristle), and FAKE American sliced cheese straight out of the Kraft wrapper. Sitting next to that is a huge pile of sliced raw onion (why??) and a gigantic "pickled jalapeno" (which is NOT pickled whatsoever, just likely boiled down with no vinegar or spices and is bitter and inedible). Out of this plate of food I ate maybe 3 fork bites of meat. No joke, that's the edible part. Of a full sandwich.  Second visit was tonight's carry out for the family which is as $35 of the coldest, fat soaked food I've ever eaten. And don't think it was cold because we showed up late. We live right around the corner and from our phone call to pickup it was 10 minutes max. Cold chicken quarter platter...so cold my kids asked why it was from a fridge. Cold and wilted "side order" fries, maybe 10 total, might I add. Smoked pork tacos that literally tasted like they had ladled the pork fat right on top to make them moist. With every bite, my mouth was coated with cold, flavorless pork fat. I actually gagged and spat it out and ate the corn salad topping for dinner. My husband also said his sandwich had no sauce but was covered in the same fat drenching, making it a soggy mess and flavorless.  Listen, if you've made it this far, don't go there. It's gross, not just disappointing, but gross. Not sure what the deal is with place, but I have no idea how they own and operate a "restaurant". I hate to add in the rude commentary, but at this point I am angry these people have taken any of my money with the terrible product they've provided me.

tPqCufKV5mp1fr3o1CK7-A.text: My first visit here after being recomended by a coworker. I'm doing a specialized diet and can't eat carbs so I just got lbs of the hot links & brisket. Great flavor and not too expensive. Lots of BBQ joints popping up in Henderson but this place seems ahead of the pack!

VTxvHu479WErrKtuxaN-uA.text: Customer service was excellent.  Our server gave us the option the option between the lean, dry end of the brisket and the fatty, wet end. We went for the lean and it was delicious.

ch8cDBeCRv1KtLETVCOu1Q.text: Sin City Smokers is a great place for anyone looking for some good, real barbecue. The space itself is charming and the staff is very friendly-happy to guide us through the menu. We had a pulled pork sandwich and bad ass fries with brisket. All delicious. The fries are amazing-and feed at least 2 if not 3 or 4. Layers of crispy fries, slightly smokey beans, slaw, cheese, and meat (these were just as good cold the next day). The iced tea, mint tea, and lemonade were delightful. My only issue was that the brisket was had a considerable layer of fat that was not pleasant.

tAsE1KGyAk1pWTxCVrl3JA.text: This review is for the brisket alone. Growing up in The South, I've had all kinds of barbecue. Folks, I swear to you that I've never had a barbecue beef brisket like I've had at Sin City Smokers. It is the best brisket that has ever touched this mouth.

1MBOVFCa22JHOkGOEjqDbw.text: First time here and it definitely wont be my last.  The food is amazing and everyone is really friendly. Great BBQ spot!!

RAjQCzj-vEzdEaPo2uUXxQ.text: Food was so good can't wait to try everything. Wonderful atmosphere staff so helpful and a pleasure to talk to. I'm so glad they are so close.

mrDUHFcvYVl8Hq7RFO5Bww.text: Was in the neighborhood, had not had a bite to eat since breakfast, so dropped in.  Ordered the brisket with a side of bbq beans. Nice smoke flavor to the meat, nicely seasoned. Moist. Beans were nice, but order is on the small side.   Ordered this as their "sandwich" method of serving, so it came on two pieces of Texas toast and a side of "appropriate slaw". The slaw was a horseradish slaw and was out of this world! This needs to be added to the sides menu! I'd order this all day everyday!  Will be back for the pork-a-strami, which per the pit master, is a brined and smoked pork loin which is finished on the flat-top, ala east-coast beef pastrami.

xSCYy8AjIEEWwIEhrKGwNQ.text: Really good brisket. I like going to local BBQ places versus franchised places.  The price is really good for what you get.

tiWRgN4eei2UZjR3cI19Ow.text: Again, another barbecue place with mediocre, dried out meat. Worse yet, it was so expensive. I got the three meats. It was in a small aluminum bowl with a tiny, tiny side of macaroni, which was watery. The meat portions were small. Nothing else came with it. The brisket wasn't so dry, but that's because half of it was fat on both pieces. All of this for a whopping $20. I won't be back.

3MkjvQXiooNbzOSQzS7CNw.text: The brisket was good but not great.  They have sweet iced tea which is a must to go with BBQ.  The people working at the restaurant were all very pleasant and helpful.  I noticed a number of regulars come and go during my visit.  Most everyone ordered the ribs...I should have looked at the trophies that they have won for the best ribs.

8ARpPuSFPPJlaOQtspj6vQ.text: Favorite bbq in Vegas! Portions are huge. Friendly customer service and great atmosphere. I eat here as much as possible.  You will not regret it!

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!!!! Best damn bbq!!!!

s-GMMOMbJUzmYEsIEjqAGw.text: I was at a work conference and Sin City Smokers was brought in to cater the event. We broke for lunch and walked outside where they were set up. The set up was awesome... I had the Mac N Cheese, Beans, Chopped Pork, Chicken and Brisket... and on the way in, I grabbed some banana pudding (Not a fan of banana pudding but it looked good so I figured I would hit it up). The food was absolutely fantastic. Once everyone got theirs, I came out and hit it up again. The food was up there with the best BBQ I've had. Their meats were smoky and moist. The sauces were terrific and the banana pudding was amazing. Couldn't of been happier with my meal. I will be stopping by on my own with the family for sure!

V2eqdDNMT49a9MDJWzT-PA.text: My husband and I visited this place for the first time after reviewing the menu at home. I was hopeful to have some good BBQ. I ordered the featured item, burnt ends. My husband ordered the Porkstar sandwich. I took one bite of my food and it was one bite too many! My husband took two bites of his sandwich and felt the same. The meat of both meals tasted boiled to the point of mush. The sauce was tasty but couldn't hide the horrible taste and texture of the poorly prepared meat. The only saving grace for more than $20 wasted was that a homeless person ate poorly today, but they ate.

PwrjYmXovizsnyRFJOrNDw.text: Steve and the Sin City Smokers crew are everything you could ever want in a caterer.  I recently hosted a corporate party for upwards of 500 people at a private residence in the outskirts of Vegas.  Steve was consistently detail-oriented and professional from our first introductory phone call.  He holds a lot of pride in his business (as he should -- the food is INCREDIBLE) and it's evident through his courteous professionalism and passion for his craft.   Now, onto the food.... he makes the absolute best brisket I have ever had.  Actually, I'm pretty sure it's the best meat I've ever eaten -- period.  Melt-in-your-mouth goodness with an incredible array of sides perfect for our audience.  We had:  "smackeroni and cheese", mashed potatoes, biscuits with honey butter, three different meat options (brisket, ribs and chicken) and salad.  Each and every item was standout delicious in its own right, but perfectly complemented one another on a (heaping!) plate.    They were on time, set up and tore down quickly, and were friendly and informative for our guests.  I'd give them six stars if I could, and won't go anywhere else when I need a caterer in Vegas.  A MUST TRY!

53DYF17ZGC4UqoaYdwLLXQ.text: This is probably the best BBQ place in town! I'm a fan of the Brisket and the Mac and Cheese! Customer service top notch! I highly suggest you check out this place. ovs_Ujw0xFwzE20ZrY1HUQ.text: This place is so good I had to force myself to stop going there because I would not have enough money to pay my other bills. It haunts my dreams. This is the kind of barbecue that would delay air force one on the tarmac while secret service picks up food and brings it back.  This is the kind of barbecue that would make cops and criminals forget their differences and just sit down at the table to eat. This is the kind of barbecue that would eliminate racial tensions across this land. This is not a paid review nor my connected in anyway to this establishment. Although if they were to pay me I absolutely would not take cash I would accept only brisket.

Anyways my husband got food poisoning a few months back and warmed me not to go there anymore.  I went earlier today and you guessed it.  I have food poisoning as I'm typing this.

7nMnwsk7NabP1fdlfX45VQ.text: Whoa. I was not expecting the food to be so freaking good. I usually don't go to BBQ spots because it is always a hit or miss but this place was a for sure hit!!   When we pulled up in front the the restaurant we were pleasantly surprised by the awesome aroma coming from inside. The inside is super cute and I love the license plate lights! I hope they do not stop making it. We only bought one for the three of us to try but we soon realized we will have to be back for more.   This place is for SURE my new spot for BBQ !!!

0NrSMTnrfV9mUlRlziWalg.text: A nice addition to the Henderson BBQ scene that seems to be growing by the day. My husband loves meat and wanted to try this spot as soon as he discovered it. It seemed like good fuel before our axe throwing league night.   Sin City Smokers Barbeque is located in an older shopping center at Sunset and Green Valley. It's not the nicest looking shopping center so I was pleasantly surprised when we stepped inside the restaurant. The restaurant is very clean and uncluttered. The Texas BBQ themed decor was cute and added to the ambiance. The counter is in the middle of the restaurant where orders are taken and then brought to the table. The entrance divides two sections of seating. The inside of the restaurant is well done for a casual dining spot. The restaurant smells amazing as soon as you walk in the door too.  The menu offers several meats and from there you choose if you want the meat in tacos, a salad, plated, as a sandwich, in a quesadilla, or on fries. There are about half a dozen side options that come a la carte. In addition there are several specialty sandwich options and daily specials. The menu doesn't look big, but there are a actually a lot of options.  My husband and I decided to share a few things. Unfortunately, they were out of ribs so we had to go with another meat. We chose Brisket and Smoked Pork. The brisket was marbled and didn't have a lean option. I really liked the flavor of it and when only eating half of the portion the amount of fat was fine. It would have been too rich for me to eat alone. The smoked pork was delicious and moist. I liked the traditional sauce that came with the meats. It had a little heat and a smoky flavor. The sweeter sauce was good, but I preferred the traditional sauce.   For sides we shared Maple Bacon Sweet Baked Beans and Jalapeno Potato Salad. We both loved the baked beans and they were sweet indeed. I love that they didn't hold back on the maple flavor. The potato salad was good and the jalapeno didn't overwhelm the flavor or add too much heat. The only disappointment was the Sweet Tea. My husband declared it garbage and upon tasting I asked if he had grabbed from the wrong drink dispenser. Hopefully it was just a bad batch and it'll be better next time.  The pricing seemed about right in comparison to other BBQ spots in the area. Most places offer a plate that comes with sides, but even with the a la carte ordering it didn't add up to more than other restaurants charge for a combination plate. It'd be cool if the plated option that comes with onions and a jalapeno included a small piece of cornbread or even a slice of white bread (traditional to Texas BBQ style).  The portions aren't as large as some other spots, but I kind of liked that it was easy to enjoy BBQ without overdoing it. With my husband and I sharing two meats and two sides I'd say that our meal was on the lighter side. Each side made a small serving for each of us.   We'll be back. Hopefully the ribs will be available next time!

ZB9hYjD41T4gFpnu5JAQ6A.text: Came here with my family today for a late lunch at around 2:30 PM one other family was there eating the atmosphere seemed clean and "barbecuey" I was excited to try this place. My father ordered the burger on their specials chalk board he loved it and his fries were delicious. My mom had the Thursday Mac and cheese special topped with burnt ends which looked amazing and my mom enjoyed it. This is where it goes wrong for me though, I ordered a two meat plate with Mac and cheese. The Mac was AMAZING, look I try Mac and cheese every damn place I go it's a sperate food group for me haha. This was very good some of the best I've had out here in Vegas. My first meat was the bbq chicken. It was moist, it was flavorful but it had a touch too much sauce for my liking on it. Overall I would order the chicken again though. The second meat choice was the brisket. This is where it fell completely below par for me. I was served a decent portion of brisket, this portion came from the point (fatty part) and it was undercooked the connective tissues were not falling apart yet(probably pulled out of the smoker an 30min to an hour too early.) It was also about 60% fat so much so that I took it back up to the counter and asked for a different portion. They then gave me a portion of the flat side of the brisket (the lean part) which was cooked perfectly it was moist and tender and had a great crust that tastes like a sumple pepper salt based rub. As someone who smokes quite a few briskets a year I believe they checked the temp of the flat portion which is much thinner than the point and left the point under cooked. The lean was very good and worth the trip out to try. However, I can not recommend the point meat I received any less. This place has trophies all over the place and claims to be championship quality bbq, but the brisket I tried today would say otherwise. I'll be back to try it again someday and maybe it was just a bad quality brisket. I'll update as I try it again in the future.

iIs9Ip3REVO2v5gikjUJkA.text: Food is really good.... but unfortunately some of the staff is not so friendly...  and actually straight up rude!! I did love coming here but after my last visit I will Be sure the next time I have a bbq craving I will make the trip to Boulder City... as the service and food is ALWAYS 100%

vFVOoZQ2AUeElG7FFla3sg.text: Our HOA had Sin City Smokers BBQ cater the block party that we have in the spring. They did a wonderful presentation of the food that was ordered. The food was flavorful and delicious. They had desserts that were tasty and you wanted to go back for more. I would have them return to cater our party again.

jnZCO-MJ-9HwQ2S7wdflZw.text: I'm always down to try new BBQ spots and usually leave disappointed. I didn't leave Sin City Smoker's disappointed, but I left wanting more. I had the Ribs and Brisket, Mac n Cheese, and the Baked beans. Ribs were good, the brisket was good, the Mac n Cheese was good, the Baked Beans were good, but nothing was Great. The sauces were one dimensional in flavor and the rub they used didn't really complement the meat. There are some BBQ places that when you take a bite it tastes special and I'm just waiting to find that in Las Vegas. This place was good and I'd be down to go back, but if I'm shelling out $ for BBQ I'm holding out for awesome or amazing BBQ not just good BBQ which is what Sin City Smokers is.   Also, the sides were too small. Like abnormally small. Especially considering the sides are a la cart to the meats and are ~ $2 each. The size of the side would have been ok had it been included with the meal but to pay for essentially 2 bites of Mac and cheese is a little silly.

uKRwYMDu9CihnYAGN5M_5A.text: Not worth the money. We came in and ordered take out which came out to $91.00. The rack of ribs we got were already cut but didn't even resemble ribs all bones and cartilage and dried out. Would never go back. I should have known the place was empty.

H-BUq3JWWiAblyQ-XWVS6g.text: Best brisket in town, hands down. Not crazy expensive either and I've tried most barbeque places in town. You gotta try this place even their smoked turkey is amazing. Their sauce is on par too. And they have a good selection of drinks and and awesome atmosphere.

w5GMI5h4-zbiI3VYVN36ug.text: Really great first experience at this little joint. The food was fantastic and really a good bargain for what you get. The sandwiches are huge. The only suggestion I would have is that the teas and lemonades where fresh and possibly made in house. By the taste it just seemed like they were from a package. The service was great and for only being open a month the crew knew the menu and had suggestions for us. Will definitely be coming back!

glSu7W4XdGpQgUHdO9DwPQ.text: Love this place. Best BBQ I've had in years. Had the Big Daddy mac & cheese Thursday,sooo good.the Brisket is smokey & juicy. Looking forward to trying the tues. spec. Tamales.

fZAFZQIrcnzvB-8siku8ZQ.text: This place is AMAZING!!  Great BBQ and the staff is always friendly. I absolutely LOVE the baked beans!! (A must try)

nkQxhiySQwK6_Mo_8abBpw.text: Worst BBQ I have ever had.  Wife and I were not impressed at all.  With all their awards that the restaurant displays - couldn't see how they could have won any.  Ribs I had were full of fat and when I complained - the server was like "oh well".

yUfnfznmF63n-Fii-9wQ9A.text: Sin City Smokers has the best BBQ I've tasted. They make great macaroni dishes and all their meats from the Pork Ribs to the BBQ Brisket is unmatched in flavor. The environment is great, the staff couldn't be more personable, and the smell of the grill will make you wish the food got there faster than it already does

nRsUo1DOLFPJv92G7zldaA.text: The guys were True professionals and produced an amazing BBQ/Ribeye dinner for a bachelor party.  They came, cooked to order on site, cleaned everything up and then took off. Couldn't have been any easier on us and the food quality was unmatched.   Thanks for a great dining experience.

52MgvCG2LBXNcuLAqxJBGg.text: Order of the brisket sandwich with a couple sides cost me $14 which is kind of pricey   The pros   Nice flavor on the brisket at the sauce good quality nicely done, not the best brisket I've ever had but above avg  The mac & cheese was all right slightly above average  The baked beans were actually the highlight of the meal might be some of the tastiest beans I can remember I've had  The cons the size of the sides really a miniature cups for two dollars each I would rather spend 2.50 to 3 dollars a side and get just a little bit more than they give, especially considering how good those beans are  They do offer what they call a plate version but I did my find another way to combine meats like most other of the barbecue places do, seems to me that they could do some work on the menu such as offering a two or a three meat combo maybe I missed it but the menu still seems to be needing a little bit more development  The staff is friendly which is a plus  This is very close to being 4stars....sure I'll give it another go and if it's good it will get bumped up there's just so many bbq places and the sides value and the ability to get more than just one meats are things that can be improved

yPaUgKBqXnEawwosIbZqQg.text: One of the best barbecue spots I've been to in vegas! Also, do yourself a favor and order the Mac n cheese....you're welcome.

4J5O3HZVsrx55FoQw2LeCg.text: Eve had brisket so good you didn't even want BBQ sauce on it? I did yesterday at Sin City!!! Brisket was incredible and we had amazing sides. Best Mac and Cheese accompanied by REALLY good baked beans. Their menu offers lots of options - my husband had a brisket quesadilla! Never heard of anything like that until yesterday and it did not disappoint. Great atmosphere and if you wonder how good it is just check out all of the trophy's as you walk in

lL8tjj2_f_-s2SreUcA8gg.text: WOW, great experience they Young lady the waited on us last night rocked!! I will be going back again there are a few items on the list the really caught my attention. I had the brisket last night so tender!!

9BF_ZfXoSV5c9WsGam7LmA.text: Sin City Smokers has some great smoked BBQ, employees that treat you like family and Steve went above and beyond to make sure our meal was done right! I had the Big Texas Salad and my hubby had the ribs with yummy Cole slaw and to die for BBQ sauce. We will definately be back! Thank you for going the extra mile for making our food and dining experience very enjoyable!

wYcr_pFSdJ3jiD4QcAZfmQ.text: Best BBQ in town! Finally a place where everything meets my expectations. Everything was tender and flavorful. The mac n cheese was amazing. And many people will agree my mom makes the best baked beans...till I tasted theirs! My only complaint or two is that they don't make collard greens AND they only serve the burnt ends in dishes and not as a choice of meat.

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Luckily there was plenty of mac to go around.

Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The side of cheese mac. Sad it was so small. It&#39;s topped with cheez it&#39;s, I&#39;ll never be able to eat it any other way.
Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Thursday special. The MAC Daddy with burnt ends and jalapeño chips. Delicious.

MyIzKjkZSSopq_d8LKeA4Q.text: This place was delicious! We happened to drive by and we glanced and saw "smokers"- we thought it could be bbq so we turned around and it was! The place is very cute and the staff was very friendly and helpful when it came to ordering takeout. I got the pork sandwich and my husband got the brisket sandwich.  We ordered mac n cheese for a side.  We ended up ordering some smoked wings too. Okay-- it was so yummy!  The wings are a must- between the smoky deliciousness and tenderness we ate them in about two seconds!  The Mac n cheese was super- they put Cheez Its on top!  Our sandwiches were awesome- the meat was tender and the bbq sauce was terrific.  They have a great dill coleslaw that was perfect on top of the sandwiches- great experience! We will be back. Normally we'd try and snap a pic but we ate everything to fast!

Nkx3IcpDpU231k2n6gwWPQ.text: To be fair we haven't eaten their food so this is no way a rating on that as I'm sure it's great!  Highly disappointed with the way we've been treated. Planning a wedding from the uk was always going to be a little tricky however we thought we'd found the perfect food vendor and were absolutely delighted!  After a month of emailing we thought the contract was finally ready to be signed after details being missed on the first two drafts being sent over...asked for the payment details and were massively let down being told the day has now been given to somebody else without even consulting us! Now I understand that we hadn't signed anything yet but you feel like after putting all that time and effort it would be secured for you but maybe that's just me and not the way I'd run my business! We now have less than 4 months and it's a national holiday and places are already booked up..to start at square one. Such a shame that something as important as a wedding can be so easily pushed aside for another booking!

4ETxBRO_TVlMRCFY1329cA.text: The food was amazing I ordered the slab of pork ribs, mac n cheese, BBQ bean, BBQ chicken, and corn bread. The customer service was awesome such a nice place...

jPUMSgkUF1TGEF4xTbGpcg.text: Having competed against the owner, Steve, at a couple local rib cook-offs, I was anxious to try his new place out.  I am glad I did.  A large group of us, about 25 or so, met up there and filled the place up.  His staff handled the sudden rush like pros.  The food was as good as I has heard it was.  My wife had the brisket and it was flavorful and tender.  I had one of their sandwiches, the Whole Hog, it was fantastic with plenty of meat on it.  The sides, I had the Smac and Cheese which was wonderful, and my wife had some fries. were on the small side for the price, $2.00. It would be nice if he had some combo plates set up, but that's not a deal breaker.   All in all it was a great visit and I would return if I happened to be in that part of town.  Maybe Steve will open one near me...

-Fsd9BNnLCSLTwvG7nK1lw.text: Sin City Smokers catered my wedding reception at an outdoor picninc site at Mt. Charleston Nevada.  As a teacher, our budget was tight so full-meal catering was not something I thought I could afford.  After stumbling upon Sin City Smokers searching the internet, I immediately recognized the awards they had accumulated, and sent the owner Steve a casual inquiry.   He called within the day and helped me plan a delicious menu that fit within my budget.  I was able to offer my guest a full meal of the most amazing American BBQ I've ever tasted for a fraction of the cost of a"typical" catering company.  Steve and his crew were professional, generous and served the most amazing food I've ever had at a wedding....luckily it was mine!  I highly recommend Sin City Smokers and will myself be looking to hire them again.  They perfected our reception and made the whole experience of working with them a pleasure!

tuAlQO45Ve-rLaJvW56Wzg.text: Simply put, my clients were thrilled. Sin City catered an event for me and I  as told by numerous guests that it was the best BBQ they've had. What more can you ask for?

T1GoUvH_GFs4xYckVJQOVA.text: The brisket was cooked perfectly. It pulled away as a great brisket should.   The Spare ribs pulled away from the bone nicely.  The Texas red sauce was AMAZING!.  I'd skip the Smack-a-Roni next time though. The Smack-a-roni was not something I will order again. The only real flavor came from the crushed Cheezits topping it.   The shoestring fries must be the Texas version be cause they were regular fries.  They were really good though with that season salt though.  I look forward to coming back for sure.

r3TKxyMXShhTGpAB2gk83Q.text: Came here with a friend for some lunch and I can definitely say I was not disappointed, got a 2 meat combo for $15.99 with one side. Also received a free side for checking in! I got the chopped pork and ribs and they were excellent! The chopped pork was smoky (but not too smoky) and full of flavor! The ribs were huge, juicy and tender! If you like good BBQ in a less crowded clean place I would definitely come here!! Great food and great portions! The staff is friendly the service was quick!! They played country music, but the food was so good I look past that (). I will be back no doubt!!

1ME3YGcB0FVWpIqorhp4zA.text: On our last Las Vegas trip we arrived at around at 7PM for the purpose of taking advantage of the ongoing $15.99 full rack of baby back ribs special only to discover it had been sold out. This trip we called ahead to reserve only to discover it was unnecessary because there were still 4 left.  Oh well, better to be safe than eat at McDonalds.  I was surprised to find the restaurant entirely empty throughout our stay, perhaps everyone was out shopping?  We were told at the counter of a Black Friday special which included not only the ribs, but one side and a soft drink.  We chose the jalapeno potato salad which was pretty good and added dillslaw which was bland.  The ribs unfortunately were slightly overcooked and served wet much to my chagrin.  Overall, a decent deal.

VumfkifVQzegdv-LJJ79jg.text: I've been to every bbq place in town, and this place takes the cake.   I've done ribs, brisket and a sandwich from them and they are all great. The sauce is great, the meat is tender and juicy, and the fat is not too over the top.  You smell the smoke wood when you first enter the restaurant, but the aroma doesn't overpower your meal.  Staff is friendly and willing to go over the menu, the restaurant is clean and cozy.  My only suggestion would be to increase portion size on the sides. $2 is a little steep for one scoop of mac and cheese or potato salad.

GF0it96s_1G_WkcZdU4zew.text: Not a super "fancy" place, but delicious food. We will definitely be back!  It's definitely a chill place to go with friends for a quick bite. We had the Texas Melt, smoked pork, and brisket with Mac and cheese, fries, and maple bacon sweet baked beans which were delicious. Pork sandwich was my favorite, but ask for extra bbq on the side!  As others mentioned, it's served in an aluminum tray (which I don't mind) and is really convenient if you have leftovers.

gnVw-Wwg0SRvd8FRDs6Klg.text: This place is so freaking good!! The first time I had it was at a wedding. I think I ate my weight in Mac and cheese. It's so cheesy with a Cheeze-It topping. Delish! The brisket is my favorite thing. It's tender and juicy and perfect. The second time I tired it was at the restaurant and it was on a Sunday. Brunswick Stew day! So delicious. And even more delicious the next day for lunch!!

hctrAPwcM3DRFH-IXdRI_w.text: My new favorite BBQ joint. Great food!!  Great atmosphere!!  And.... they love America! And support the sheep dogs!!!!  Everything is good.

63y7G196KKMF_e9_fEPfQQ.text: Hostess was super helpful & friendly. Brisket & Smoked Pork delicious  Baked beans awesome!!

7EypkgszUpW138V4ilUt7Q.text: Let me tell you....this is the best BBQ in all of Las Vegas. I grew up in Kansas City and love good BBQ. I'm not saying this is Kansas City BBQ but it's great BBQ. My Daughter loves their chicken and corn bread. My wife who is very picky, loves this place as well. They definitely take pride in their craft. Daddy mac,  Texas melt and more are all very tasty.

6wXCgE4Kyf0KKHDHrQ4O0A.text: BEST BBQ EVER! SOOO happy that the restaurant portion is finally open! My family and friends and I have used them multiple times for catering, after finding them at a bbq competition (which they always do AMAZING at), and we have NEVER been disappointed! ALWAYS an awesome staff, great food, and the owners are really cool too!   GREAT prices, especially considering the awesome quality you get! sides are made from scratch, the sauces are ALL their own, and OMG.... i really can't put into words how great everything is!   personally, I'm working on trying everything on the menu, so far, so good!

Khr5uL06keaumVdTalPECA.text: Loved this BBQ. We got a sampler and it was too much even for two. Love sauces. Lady behind counter was helpful. Won lots of trophies in BBQ world. Will definitely be back!

t4UXAQsfRSoKsImE3iopCg.text: Depends on what you get, some items are generous portions some leave you hungry for more. They have Country time lemonade and sweet tea

0A6LglvKSLm6v66IoqR--w.text: For those of you who don't want to read a detailed review:  GO GO GO...the food is friggin' ridiculously amazing!  And for those who want details:  The strip mall was deserted, it was late afternoon on a Sunday.  They looked closed due to the darkened windows but that was not the case.  Country music was playing, we were greeted immediately upon entering and asked if it was our first time in.  It was so they explained how the menu worked (super helpful!).  I ordered the brisket on Texas toast, baked beans and coleslaw with dill.  OMFG... Brisket:  incredibly tender!  Our server recommended putting the barbecue sauce and the horseradish on the sandwich.  Being a foodie, I had to taste both the barbecue sauce and the horseradish prior to dressing my brisket.  OMFG once again!  The horseradish was not overpowering and had crunchy cabbage in it (it rocked!).  The barbecue sauce...wow...not sweet, acidic, secret recipe...I added them both as suggested.  Best idea ever! Baked beans:  Sweet with maple coming through nice and strong with a subtle hint of bacon.  LOVED.  It could have been my dessert and I almost drank the sauce left over after the beans were gone. Dill coleslaw:  Not too much mayonnaise (I hate mayonnaise!) and the flavor of dill came through although it was not overpowering (perfect and fresh tasting!). Chicken:  Barbecued perfectly and sooooo tender!  The barbecue sauce on the chicken was different than the brisket sauce; sweet but not overpowering.  Jalapeno potato salad:  Once again, not too much mayonnaise and the jalapeno did not burn your mouth in the slightest, it only added a special touch to what can be a common, boring side dish.  Oh how good it was! Beverages:  Oh the options!  The mint tea (with fresh mint and unsweetened) was so refreshing!  The sweet tea was delicious too.  All brewed on site, none of that crap coming out of a soda machine dispenser!  Also saw a pitcher of cherry lime aid, you KNOW that has to be delish! I'm coming back and dessert will be on the agenda as well as the food! I'm a huge fan.  HUGE.

wXHkhhZgdSiFMozSToHuLQ.text: OH MY GOD!!!! Just tried this place for the first time... The food is AMAZING!!! My hubby was born and raised in Texas and always brags about real "Texas BBQ"... He bragged about Rudy's in Texas and how nothing ever comes close to it. Well... I'm here to tell ya.... this place far exceeds Rudy's Texas BBQ!!! I ordered the "Porkstar" BBQ Pork AND Mac N Cheese on Texas Toast.... I am in a total food coma right now! The Maple Bacon BBQ Baked Beans are phenomenal!! My 9 year old daughter ordered the B.S.L.T (Bacon steak, Lettuce and Tomato on Texas Toast. If you think bacon is life then this is the sandwich for you! My hubby got the Tater Nachos.... holy crap! They have everything on them!!! Sweet Potato Fries with Honey Badger Sauce.... soooo good!!! And their BBQ Sauce.... Sweet or Spicy? I couldn't decide so I had both! LOL HUGE portions, great prices and oh the desserts!!!! I cannot wait to go back on Wednesday for the Baked Potato Special! This is our new favorite BBQ spot! (And we don't have to drive 1800 miles to get there!)

KqldKhw7eM7CT72zIDJ1GQ.text: Great place to dine on killer Barbecue. I can see how they won so many awards. Felicia was very helpful in showing all the options on their fabulous menu.

BGnEXvAu9AYTGdChf448KQ.text: Consistently great BBQ across multiple visits and trying multiple items off the menu. One thing to note is that they sometimes run out of specific menu items...kinda sums up how good the place is.

-fqVyfq2zESaFEpoNSwK4w.text: I'm originally from Memphis and have had my fair share of great barbecue. In fact, I usually bring back pulled pork and sauce when I visit. Living in Las Vegas, I've always said I have yet to find barbecue that compares to True Southern barbecue, until now.  Sin City is AMAZING! Without a doubt, this is the best barbecue in Vegas. All the sides are great, too. I'm also a stickler for service and whether placing an order over the phone or dining in, the staff is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VfS6ufQhc88ahSoW7otcrA.text: My husband and I went here last weekend for the first time. The food was delicious and I was so happy that they had a vegetarian option also. My husband got the brisket sandwich and said it was the best meat ever... It was fall apart tender. Basically, you choose your meat type, choose how you'd like it (tacos, sandwich, etc), and then you can choose a side if you want. The mac and cheese (smack-aroni) was amazing. They also have a ton of sauces to choose from. The decor is unique and we liked the funny signs up all over. The staff was so friendly, what you'd for at a small family-owned business. The only suggestion: It was $6 for a can of local microbrew beer, but we would have also been happy if there were cans of cheaper beer at a lower price (under $5) or pints from a tap if we're paying $6.

rT1WpKWV0_gLnbdFWcW6Cw.text: This is a nice little BBQ place that's kind of hidden. I ordered the Texas Melt and felt like the beef was a little dry, they do have their BBQ sauce that I smothered it in. Their fries are delicious, I'd definitely order a side of fries with your meal. Love the environment, very country themed with country music playing. The ladies at the front are super nice and friendly.

tgcr8tAvp-FhudSUuzjzuw.text: After a month or so of exploring the menu, this BBQ is legit. I feel like the brisket just keeps getting better!  The daily specials are refreshing additions to the typical choose your BBQ meat offerings.  I especially enjoyed the tamales, stuffed baked potato and the Friday babybacks! The creamy dill slaw is my favorite side hands down followed closely by the almost dessert baked beans.  We come here nearly weekly now sometimes even twice a week since we work across the street.  It's great having Steve & his team in the neighborhood! Keep up the solid work!  Come check this place out if you haven't...we want to keep em around!

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. God bless &#39;Merica! BBQ, stars, stripes &amp; a stack of hickory...why else do you need?

dOqBbMZ_h_5vpNyC2MJq9Q.text: I wouldn't say it's the best and I wouldn't say it's the worst. It also could have been an off day because it wasn't that busy. The food didn't seem very fresh either some pieces of chicken were slightly cold. The flavor yes is good especially when using one of the sauces. The flavor of the meat was good. My hubby had the chicken sandwich he said it was just ok and he's the BBQ snob lol! And the side or smack a roni was so small and he said mushy. He also had high hopes Seeing all the pictures on IG made us want to drive and try this place. But it wasn't what I expected. They won lots of trophies which is really amazing. It just wasn't my favorite.

Ls-JqphXgYgfUiOLoYSJdQ.text: Wow, this is some good BBQ! Our eyes were pretty big and we ordered a lot of food, it was all very good. The beans are ridiculous!! Like maple and bacon heaven  The staff is super friendly and the place is really cute with its vintage-esque signage decor.  I actually had thrown away my Invisalines and when asked if I could gain access to the 2 barrels to search for them, the girl got elbow deep with me - I kept telling her she didnt have to help and she just kept cheerfully saying "it's my job" Lol   There's a reason for all those trophies at the entrance, go find out for yourself how great their food is!

1mlbaH1AUO9WbEyxCQj9-Q.text: FOOD POISONING!!!!! EAT AT YOUR OWN RISK!  My husband and I ate here with my niece and ordered the following:  red beans and rice, catfish, and bad ass fries with beef brisket.  My husband and I got food poisoning. I missed two days of work because of eating here. Surprisingly, my niece did not get sick...but, she did not eat much of the food and only ate the fries.  My husband and I were not as lucky!  Was the food good?  Yes for the most part...seemingly anyway.  Was it worth being up all night sick throwing up (me and my husband) and me being sick for two days thereafter with stomach aches, and all the "fun" symptoms of food poisoning?  Nope!  I mean...I've had better BBQ elsewhere AND didn't get sick from it!!  BE CAREFUL!

r16IagoabCe80llGBKMHfQ.text: Wow!   Thank god for web searches.  This was an absolute find for us.  A few miles off the strip and in a strip mall.  Wasn't expecting greatness.  The staff was friendly and welcoming.  Explained their process and different styles of bbq.  We ordered a special- the 5 meat sampler " Big Daddy???"   Brisket, sausage, chicken, pork ribs and chopped pork.  Sides were Mac n cheese and fries.  2 types of sauces, sweet or mildly spicy.  All were wonderful.  Enough to take home for the 2 of us.  Will definitely be back when in town.

h76NXgc7p-LG82w0rd_eRA.text: Best BBQ! Ok, I love BBQ and have legitimately tried almost every BBQ place in Vegas and, in my opinion, this one rules! Not only are the meats delicious and cooked wonderfully, the sides are amazing! I have had their cornbread, beans, Mac and cheese, and for the first time tonight had their buffalo cauliflower- which is why I had to yelp this place tonight- it was delicious! Not kidding, go try all of it!!! They have daily specials as well as their everyday menu.  Their sides are a little on the small side but you get a whole lot of your main dish so it kinda works out.  They also have yummy homemade deserts in their refrigerator like banana pudding, blueberry cheesecake and chocolate lava cake.

VJPWUM1qzTtQ18_aBkqD2w.text: The brisket here is like none I have had West of the Mississippi. Really succulent and crave-worthy.  I also thought the ribs were delicious and tender.  The sauce is a mixture of tangy and sweet.  Even the barbecue chicken, which I'm kind of picky about (my family is excellent at making this), impressed me.  It was not dry! That's the typical problem.  Still, as good as it is, it is not as good as the other two dishes.  The baked beans are a perfect complement to this, as well as the cheesy baked mac and cheese.  This is a throw away your diet for a day kind of meal, but you will think it's worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cornbread Monday

VscXgTTozFHW4Fh3prz83g.text: Heaven here on Earth. Sin City Smokers provided catering for 2 of my accounts. It was amazing! A delicious hit! The brisket barely lasted 20 minutes, the Mac n cheese is -slap someone- delicious, the lemon bars should be behind bars for tasting so good. There is so much more to say, but instead of telling you... Get out there and try the food for yourself! You WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED.

s1I-8RRrgytlwx6BMTxidQ.text: I don't know what kinda cockamamie show these people have going on here but I am in shock of these amazing reviews. For 14$ and change I received the slimiest no flavor "piece" of chicken I have ever seen or tasted. The two "sides" (the special: vinegar coleslaw was effing horrendous and the mac n cheese equally disturbing) served in a paper ketchup sized bowl. Everything was thrown in a foil takeaway container with a side of raw white onions.   Pitiful.  Also, the people who work here are oblivious and basically retarded. I'm assuming it's their friends and family who have flooded their yelp with positive reviews.   Hands down, the biggest waste of money. You'd probably get better BBQ chicken at Carl's Jr around the corner.

_74cgzJkxozo6g5qXFcWvQ.text: Big portions, delicious, and good price. Can't believe I just found out about this place, love it and can't wait to try their different items. I got the whole hog sandwich and a cheesecake. The sandwich was meaty and very filling. The cheesecake was also very good. Think it was a non bake cheesecake and it wasn't too sweet, which I liked.

hfIVHApsqLGWowHY4Dw-hQ.text: You have to try this place! The sandwiches are amazing. We couldn't decide what sandwich to order so we got two and split them. I cant pick which one I like better, the texas sandwich or the one with macaroni and cheese on it. Pick both. I cant wait to try the salsa Verde quesadilla when it is the special again. I'll definitely be back. And my food did not get soggy on the way home in Boulder city.

AoJVuGdn6sv6Pc2CJfhSqw.text: Really wanted to try the Porkstar but they ran out of brisket so they replaced it with chicken. Also got the bomb ass fries. Was disappointed they didn't have what I wanted as I saw in the photos which drew me there, but I still loved the food. It was still very tasty and hit the spot. Will be back and hope they'll have the brisket next time.

zDtIBUHCGGCxhLSQ7RC_xg.text: This is some downright delicious bbq. I've had the brisket, pulled pork, and the tacos are really good. Nothing has been dry and can taste the smokey flavor. And those speciality sandwiches! Really like the texas melt and porkstar if craving mac n cheese. Never had a bad meal there. Real bbq!

Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porkstar

aQ6nDVFHuNGf1PuI1Rqk4w.text: I stopped here for lunch today, and I was pleasantly surprised! I ordered the Brisket Baked Potato and I must say, I enjoyed the meal. As soon as you walk through the door, you can smell that wonderful BBQ smoke. You're also greeted by friendly staff. The walls are tastefully decorated and they got one impressive trophy cabinet. It was my first time there, but I'll go back if I'm in the area.

khH8z-kg1yPgdm_f2KWgWA.text: We just moved here from Hawaii and have been eating everywhere and thought we found "Our" go-to BBQ Spot until we happen to just find this place by accident.  The ambiance is homey but the food WOW!  Talk about "Wanna Smack Your Mama".  Thought we had the best of the best cause we've had good BBQ in Texas, North Carolina to say the least but SCSB is a front runner for us!  So good that the pickiest of our children loved her Mac-N-Cheese!  For us the Big Daddy Platter was the highlight.  The ribs, smoked sausage, Chicken, Smoked Pork & Brisket my heavens I am drooling just writing this review.  We chose the Baked beans & Mac-N-Cheese and they also have us Texas Toast.  My hubby and I shared the platter and we couldn't even finish it in one sitting.  My daughters loved their Porkstar!  All in all we loved SCSB so much we came back for dinner the very next day...lol. Thank you for the food it was as we say in Hawaii "ONOLICIOUS" (Delicious).  Mahalo & Fa'afetai tele lava (Thank you in Hawaiian & Samoan)

wpsSjYv_OauJA_4dYBZEgw.text: Great customer service. Meats are good. Could improve sides to more options, but overall a good place for your bbq fix!

JAsPhzPthsEpRn-BEbUP3g.text: Thought we would try a different place for lunch on a Thursday and decided on Sunday City Smokers Barbecue.  The location used to be a sushi bar, but you can tell the building inside and out has been remodeled.  Walking in you pass a very impressive wall of trophies!  I tried the Thursday special - St. Lewis short ribs and a side (I chose the shoestring fries).  Hey don't have a fountain soda machine, but have a good assortment of both cans and bottles (both Pepsi and Coke products) plus several other choices.  The staff were all very friendly and helpful.  The seating area was clean, and the decorations are kinda fun.  The food tasted good.  Definitely worth trying again!

JZsZMzt5GsV9ItwuyJgGTg.text: This is an average bbq joint. The burger is cooked fresh with basic toppings. AgT5Xx23P8vBVsWh-xwQCw.text: Great food.  Not overly smokey.  The brisket green chili quesadilla is amazing.  HUGE portions for the price.  Serves beer and wine.

T5aLK8NoS-4-CDsq7Qs4vQ.text: Henderson all of a sudden has a ton of BBQ but this one is the best. A family of 4 could fill up on the bad ass fries and they are very good. Pork star a hit with the kids. Brisket great. Thick cut bacon a heart attack in the making but possibly worth it.

fpTsecSwfBKlw1lYdgyqgw.text: Great BBQ spot!! The ribs are outta this world. Meat just falls off the bone! Got the combo which comes with 5 different meats. The chicken is so good. The brisket is tasty. Even the sweet tea is good. Nothing bad to say about this place at all. Relaxing atmosphere with country music playing.  Feels like you are in Texas. Highly recommend this place. You won't regret coming here.

D2_5cs4AwtJRZ7rdlbOEIw.text: It was delicious, some of the best brisket I have had and easily top 3 in Vegas. I will be coming back, although on take out orders you can plate it a little bit better other than that it was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_PBtlOLpo-QTSQlSY7UnAA.text: JUST WOW!!! I mean like it was my husband's Birthday, I had just finished making a Presentation to the staff at the One Stop at the Green Valley Library across the street from 'Sin City" and all of a sudden, after I finished presenting, I stopped and asked one of the attendees; "Do you know of a good place that serves B.B.Q? Without hesitation, I was told simply: "Sin City". Well, I just couldn't let my husband's Birthday pass without celebrating with some quality barbecue and that's JUST WHAT I FOUND at Sin City!!! The happy faces that greeted me as I placed my order was a welcome change to other eateries I'd been to in the area and then, my heart nearly "skipped a beat" when they brought out our orders of a rack of pork ribs, corn bread and creamy coleslaw!! Then I ate......That rack of ribs nearly had me up and dancing with delight!!! Very, very little fat on that rack and maximum flavor-ishous meat with two sauces to go along with it to boot!! The corn bread and creamy coleslaw did not disappoint either and were the perfect compliment to our ribs. The portion were also perfect too. Not too much and not too little either. The vibe of the place is "so bomb" too. You'll love the rustic, funky feel there too. THANK YOU SIN CITY FOR A WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE!! WE SHALL RETURN!!!!

zjYLjRFjjn2Ynb-n3mKqhA.text: Once you walk into this place there are many trophies from different BBQ competitions, so right away I knew it was going to be a quality meal...i wasn't wrong. I didn't want to spend a whole lot so I went for the $8.99 loaded baked potato with brisket. (You can choose whichever meat you'd like) They bring out this massive potato piled high with brisket cheese sour cream BBQ sauce and chives. The brisket had the best smoky flavor on it and was tender not dry at all. I will definitely be back to try the baby backs and pulled pork. Very friendly staff. If you want some serious award winning BBQ take a trip to Henderson and treat yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loaded baked potato with brisket.  Delicious.

TNeEUKlzTOrIbSnH8ueAjA.text: Here was my first time trying Sin City Smokers and I was disappointed. The baby back ribs were over cooked and tough to eat. The smoke flavor was way overpowering. The only reason I gave 3 stars was the mac and cheese and the jalapeno potato salad were good.

yoKQxLD9wAyZxkuv4Dk1Tg.text: This place is the real deal! The BBQ is fantastic,the sides are fantastic and the staff is very friendly. Found this place on accident today. Very unassuming Strip-mall.

A man that mentored me for years retired today and sin city came through with a unbelievable spread. Makes me look good to my customer consistently. Not sure how he's going to top today's performance.

AhK7ZzuhsesRkwKmwRytjg.text: Really good food! Amazing quality. The Chef Steve really only seems to care about making good BBQ. The smoked meats have smokey flavor all the way through.  The slices of brisket are thick and satisfying. The burnt ends are the largest and juiciest I've ever had. The sandwiches are unique and have a perfect balance of flavors. There are three BBQ sauces; none are super spicy but all taste good.  The price is right too! My friends like me really like the cheap giant salads. For dessert lovers they have a selection if rotating desserts that are tasty too.  Service is great too, everyone is super friendly. Definitely recommended

xOI4XMmlEhNkPBRgU8EacA.text: Best BBQ in town. Brisket and Babybacks on point!    Try the Bad Ass Fries. (Yes, that's what they're called)  Definitely earned their reputation, ratings and awards.   I think may be able to skip my next 4-5 meals.

x-j9aUynaatZf6KSmgjl_Q.text: Delicious food! And their costumer service was amazing! Beautiful restaurant too!   This place is totally a meat eater spot but does have a nice creative menu for people who dont eat meat which I thought was neat! Really appreciated that!

2AZscCd7Mrrd6NPEN-xMCQ.text: Had lunch here with a customer of mine. Food was so good I had them cater two parties I had upcoming. Brisket is to die for. Great bark, juicy, wonderful smoke, and incredibly tender. Sausage was tasty and I loved the sauces.   Service was great in store and catering service was outstanding, friendly, timely, and everything with a smile. They are my go to caterer now in Las Vegas and my favorite BBQ house in the area. Worth the drive to Henderson.

nEHeG08k2p9KOcJi1VdAUQ.text: Was very happy. Steve and team were awesome when I walked in and told them what I like and what I needed. Appreciate that he walked me through his smoking process.   Brisket was on point.  Fatty and lean were both good. Tender and great bark.   Mac and cheese with the Cheezits were solid.  Glad he adds a little crunch  Beans were amazing.  Great consistency and flavor  Service was real good.  Team was engaged with me.   Banana pudding with real solid but the pb&j pudding was one of the best desserts I've had in a long time.

zgSaX5PXQYJ-pX-Da8AYGg.text: Felicia WAS AWESOME!! We always get the TOP experience at sin city smokers! Highly recommend this place for amazing service, and satisfying high quality BBQ meat!

v1g04akKMB9z4uoCLV2M4w.text: My friends visited me from LA last weekend. They said they wanted bbq and found this place on Yelp. It is right down the street from me and I was surprised that I didn't know about it. Best bbq I've ever had. We ordered pork ribs, brisket, pulled pork, dill slaw, beans and corn bread. So good, not a day goes by that I don't think about it. My buddy Dennis asked me what I thought tasted best. All I could tell him was, its all good! I couldn't decide....everything was equally delicious including the sides. Truly unbelievable. Trying to go back for more this weekend. You have to try this place out! 6 stars

IAedINdM1kzr1-UKUqaaYQ.text: For me,  there's nothing more enjoyable that BBQ that is prepared well.  Today was my first visit to Sin City Smokers and  The only disappointment I am feeling is that I did not discover it sooner.     I went in to pick up some brisket and ribs to take home and when I took my first bite I couldn't have been happier.  The brisket was beyond tender and the ribs fell off the bone and the sauces are perfectly suited for the meat. Combine this with extremely cordial service will make for a return visit.  Next time will back to dine in to try some of the many offerings.  Definitely worth a visit.

_5tAUJzC1uWhA5_kyBBECw.text: Hands down the worst bbq I've ever had in my life! My wife and I ate there on last Thur (9/5). Her food came out about 15 mins before mine and I should have known to leave then. She had the brisket and I had the big Mac and daddy. Her brisket was dry and my meal was all around gross.

G9BDGlsz04kbtCiJhMSx2w.text: Sin City Smokers... Where to begin? Well, I'd begin 1st off by giving a tip. Go to the right BBQ joint in the shopping center, not the wrong one. I'm still trying to figure that one out. Anyways. I'm a huge fan of Sin City Smokers. From the meats I've had, to the sides, as well as the customer service.   I originally found out about this place from a co-worker of mine. He bragged about the ribs, so I got a half rack with a side for $7.99... Two days later I convinced 3-4 other co-workers to pitch in and we bought FOUR racks of ribs with two quarts of sides and eight cornbreads. That's how good Sin City Smokers is.  I've had their food three times now, but I've only had one type of meat up there. Ribs. Thank you Lord for those ribs. I smell the smoke when I get out of my car, and I taste the smoke in every bite. The ribs aren't exactly "fall off the bone" tender, however they are tender. They have a little bite to um. But I don't mind a little bite in my ribs.   The only sides I've had are the maple baked beans and the mac & cheese. Those beans are so sweet & tasty though. I can remember exactly how they taste as I'm doing this review. The mac & cheese has "cheeze-it" crackers crunched and mixed in the macaroni & cheese, which is unique, but in a good way. I plan on trying the Texas Ranchers beans next time I go.  I'd highly recommend Sin City Smokers if you're in Henderson and want BBQ. Hell, I'd recommend them regardless of where you are in the Vegas Valley. Its well worth the drive!

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Whole Hog sandwich w/pulled pork, bacon, and ham, grilled onions and American cheese on TX toast!

qlKfu3uBcgpI70MfwPApDA.text: To borrow a line from Tracy Morgan "I like this sandwich so much I want to take it behind a 7 eleven and get it pregnant" The Texas Melt Sandwich is a signature item at Sin City, order one and you'll see why.-Consummate perfection and delicious overkill in every bite.   The Texas Melt consists of angus beef brisket (wonderfully tender, moist, and flavorful,but not soggy or overcooked), pepper jack cheese, roasted red peppers,Texas red sauce and grilled onions on buttery Texas toast, and tasty but not too hot picked peppers on the side-so incredibly good and so bad for you!    The place has cool bbq headquarters feel to it and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable.   My only quibble is the 5 cheese Smack-a-Roni-mac n cheese, which nobody at our table liked. I'm pretty tolerant of processed cheese but it had a very yucky cheese wiz taste to it not the 5 cheese mac they're going for. I almost had the porkstar sandwich which is crammed with it.   That aside the brisket was just awesome. It a cut that's so difficult to barbecue that it's a measuring yard of a good BBQ restaurant. Here in town I've had overcooked crumbly brisket and stiff as a board dry brisket (from the now closed Pot Liquor). This brisket is just perfection and I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Texas Melt. -  oh yessss!

Ael2Ga4x9XBNZs8a8RRsYA.text: Plastic knife and fork, why? Full rack smothered in BBQ sauce, why? $2 for a side of Mac n Cheese seemed a bit steep to me, ribs were not hot, smothered in sauce and plastic ware are all turnoffs for me, others may not care about these things, I was disappointed.

fF4En2YKCjjdjDCDtQQvQQ.text: Thank the BBQ Gods for blessing us with this amazing place. Sin City BBQ is my new favorite spot. Seriously came home and told everyone I saw about this place!   We went on a Friday, and the Friday deal was Baby Back Ribs. We got the platter with 5 meats and 2 sides! They threw in some of the baby back ribs (so we actually got 6 meats ). We checked in with Yelp and got a third side too! Don't judge our fatness.   They have side specials, so we decided on the buffalo fried cauliflower, with menu sides of Mac n' Cheese and Potato Salad! GET THE POTATO SALAD, you will not regret it.

f_OUDZTSk6oaOfdGdQZ1wQ.text: My husband, friend and I came in last week to try this place out. We didn't know the place was here until the ad came across my Facebook feed. We have a BBQ place we like to go to in North Las Vegas. I'm glad to have found a place that is near us finally! I'm from Texas and I'm quite a snob about my barbecue!! The portions were amazing as well as the prices. While I'm trying to eat better these days it's unfortunate this place is so close to us!! Haha!  I tried the lemonade and sweet tea. That was my only hang up. I wish the tea was a little sweeter as well as the lemonade. I had the pork star and my husband and I shared the bad ass fries. Amazing!!! I'm so looking forward to coming back here again!!

yKuxs0kIGaoaUSOVMBuzTg.text: These guys are such pros, and believe me they did not let us down. From first contact all the way to service delivery, Christie looked after us and ensured that everything we asked for was adhered to on our wedding day. The brisket was insanely good, everyone at the reception commented on it - even a Las Vegas veteran who knows his stuff about eating out said it was the best brisket he'd tasted in town. That says a lot! The quality of food, service and value for money is impressive, I highly recommend these guys for any wedding reception or event function. They clean up pretty good to like they were never there. They will not let you down. Thanks again Christie! We appreciate all you did for us (and for the leftovers the following day, tasted EVEN BETTER, especially that macNcheese - oh my gosh...... I'm drooling typing about it!!!! Haha)

Nice atmosphere wasn't crowded when I went around 6 o'clock which wasn't a bad thing. Tea was pretty solid and had free refills. I honestly didn't care for the sides but it was still pretty good. I think it was the ribs that stole the show for me

3d90GXpuy_t4najFofui2A.text: The best barbecue that I've had in Henderson. Nice little restaurant. The sides dont have as much "soul" (hint hint wink wink) as is my preference but good enough. I don't recommend the mac and cheese. Idea is better than the execution. It's essentially kraft plus chez-Its. My only real complaint. Ive liked: BSLT, Brisket (was as close to being in Texas that I've had), Texas Melt and baked beans. ..good lemonade (not too sweet). Friendly service. Really clean. Look at their review history. You'll see what I mean. Post mates delivers (Here's $100 in FREE Postmates delivery fee credit (good for 7 days). Sign up with my code A9YQV or this link springboard.postmates.co...)

_WynyTtHamamUp06ZI2Arg.text: I have had this spot in my radar for quite a while, finally gave it a go. Upon entry to this spot, I liked the down home feel and decor of the place. Reminds me of a few small town BBQ spots I've been to in CA & AZ. The gal upfront was very polite and cheerful, told her I was a newbie and was asking what her recommendation was. This spot has daily specials and everything looked good, so needed to narrow it down. The sandwich options looked awesome, was told that the porkstar would quench the beast in my belly. Glad I listened, it was an amazing grilled cheese and mac & cheese with chunks of chopped pork. As an added bonus, with a checkin on yelp you can get a free side. The shoestring fries were pretty good and loved the seasoning they came in. The sandwich was perfect and stuffed with piggy, mac n cheesy goodness. All in all was a really good small place to grab some great grub for a good price. Will definitely be back for more.
