qIP3XSWB_b9GfcZsrBxyrQ.text: I would not recommend this place to anyone. The food is not that great. The meat is very dry and the sides are literally bite size. For the amount of money you pay you can definitely find a better BBQ place to go to and get better portions for the same price.

TGo9GAICTypxYxk8P_GoaQ.text: Great bbq at great prices!   They keep it's simple with their 6 meats to choose from and you build from there to make any thing from tacos/quesadillas to the Bad Ass fries which are a favorite of mine! Everyone should have them on their must try list when visiting this establishment. I like to add the smoked pork to my bad ass fries.  I have also tried the bbq chicken on a sandwich, DELICIOUS.  They also offer daily specials. I happened to go on a Sunday when the special was the Brunswick stew, DELICIOUS! Very filling and stick to your ribs good.  The fries are in a league of their own. Very well seasoned and addicting, I couldn't stop myself. The way the meats/meals are served is traditional of how bbq is served in many parts of the country (over raw white onion with a grilled jalapeno) If you don't like it simply ask for your dish plain.  Anyway I'll definitely be back for some more delicious bbq, looking forward to trying more of the daily specials which I've heard are (ALL) great!

fpThYX6JV6Mvoc4DypJTkA.text: Some of the best Brisket and BBQ I've ever had. Really glad I stopped by here tonight. The service and friendliness of the staff made the night.

FMGF0fBRjuNmouENF3b0bw.text: Amazing!!! Best BBQ I have ever had! The Texas melt sandwich is pure heaven the brisket melts in your mouth like butter! And the service is outstanding! The girls they hired are super sweet and helpful greatly appreciated thank you! I highly recommend this place if I could give more than 5 stars I would!

m53cYG7AivwxJO-KzKFQkQ.text: Sin city smokers catered our wedding on 4/14/18 and every guest was impressed, full, and asking where they could get this food regularly. Kennedy (I know I didn't spell that right) was our go to girl on our special day and she didn't disappoint, great job, girl! Christie was amazing with the prep leading up to our day and she was an absolute pro! We are so thankful we decided to spend a bit more than the chain bbq(not even that much more if I'm being honest) and get the best! Thank you to sin city smokers for an impressive, professional, and fully satisfying reception dinner!!

oZXU5R94uM3-q6u88EKHJg.text: Best BBQ in Las Vegas! Unreal taste and amazing atmosphere. Cleanliness was off the chart as well. Customer service 10 star. So disappointed that we found this place on our last day here. BLESS YOURSELF WITH THIS FOOD!

fD95_Ki9pSiYdWdQpgjY6A.text: Best brisket and fish we've had since moving to Las Vegas over 8 1/2 years ago. We've tried a lot of BBQ restaurants and this place is by far the best. We're from Southeast Texas so we know BBQ well. Their BBQ tamale Tuesday special is also delicious. Big portions and great prices. It's also extremely clean and the staff is very friendly. Highly recommend Sin City Smokers. Go check this place out. You will not be disappointed.

7xZ6OPIfIY1S2WPlXOY4zw.text: I rarely write a poor review, but this business was an exception.  I went based on the reviews in Yelp.  I ordered the special of the day which was a base of mac and cheese, with pieces of "burnt ends" of beef brisket.  It was then supposed to be covered with more mac and cheese and fried jalapenos.    It  arrived in a tin foil take out bowl (even though I was eating in) accompanied by a plastic fork and knife.  The mac and cheese was lukewarm, with a not more than 5 small pieces of meat on top if it.  The mac and cheese was only OK, but the meat was terrible.  Burnt ends (at least in Texas) are meaty and juicy.  Here half of the meat was just fat, and the other half was dried out and incredibly tough to eat.  There were a few small (less than 5) small pieces of jalapeno.  The waiter came over to ask how the meal was.  It told him it was terrible.  The meat was dried out with little flavor.  In virtually every other restaurant when I tell someone that I don't like a dish, they immediately offer to replace it with another dish and often offer to refund my money.  Here at Sin City, he simply stared at me when I told him how bad I thought the food was, and offered me nothing.  I then got up and left.  Unfortunately a very poor experience all around.

5pGNN30i91vYQ8I8UEGGzw.text: They have some really good food at this restaurant I would be really happy if they catered a family event for me and my loved ones maybe when we get together and have a family where you did they could come and cater our family were Union hopefully they're willing to travel

qpV4ZV95KcIhvrQdgH6iVw.text: The brisket was on point.  They key to the sandwich was to add the tangy sauce and horseradish slaw. The ribs were not on par with the brisket.  They were chewy and only "one note" of flavor coming through.  They were served cold and the sauce on top tastes slightly raw. Thy needed more smoke or caramelization to really make them stand out. The sides are small but well prepared.  The fried were over salted but tasty.  Not bad for a mid morning lunch during the week.

cEoF89OE8Ol-j_GmEh37Sg.text: Delicious burnt ends. Juicy brisket. No frills presentation. Friendly, sincere staff :)

Rn3wMUrSvbCsrX-YDc8Tnw.text: Fantastic food with exploding finger licking taste. I highly recommend this place if you want good BBQ. Award winning with all the trophies being displayed. I ordered the Big Daddy platter- 2 sides of brisket and chicken platter. Highly recommend the brisket. I love  the Jalapeno potato  salad and cornbread. A place you must check out.

8l9UrTGVh7xVNFudUycN6g.text: Okay, So we have been to Sin City Smokers many of time both my family and my co-workers, we dropped a business card, and we received a Catered Lunch today (THANK YOU STEVE) Bella was on time, very professional,  set up a BEAUTIFUL spread for my employees... and did we ENJOY every last bite...Actually there is enough left over for some of the employees to enjoy AGAIN TOMORROW... THANK YOU AGAIN STEVE & CREW... We will be back.. The Solevita Team

4cy7Xm-U1Ws4FUBmIP7_LA.text: I would say that this place is among the top 3 BBQ joints in he Las Vegas valley.  As with all BBQ joints, I tried their brisket as a baseline... Their brisket was quite fatty, and it was definitely juicy.  A little too fatty if you ask me, however, at least it wasn't dry.  I also wasn't a fan of the BBQ sauce that came with the brisket.  It was very vinegary.  What really shined here was the bark on the brisket.  Perfect texture, not too salty... Just excellence.  The house black BBQ sauce was very good too.    We had the creamy dill slaw for a side which was decent, bit a little heavy when paired with the fatty brisket.  Service was excellent.  Pricing was fair.  I am excited to try their other offerings at another visit.

taWLni4bJi2FH-tQkhQhzg.text: Bruh.   A friend has been posting pictures everytime she goes to lunch here,  all over her facebook. Im not big on BBQ, to be really honest,  but Dayyymmmmm.   So, i Facebook stalked the SCS page. Every day,  they post a video of their chef making that day's special.  Guys. Don't watch.  I've gained 50 pounds this week.   Okay, so, fast forward to two weeks, to when my man and i finally have a day off together,  and i begged..... (not really). This place is a 35 minute drive from our house, and we have other errands to run.  But.... lunch.    We walked in. It's CLEAN.  It smells like heaven. Its got the decor you'd expect,  and i loved. I wanted to steal several pieces for my kitchen   So, we walk up to the counter, and a lovely blonde gal (I'm so sorry for not catching your name)  asked if we'd been in before,  and we admitted we had not.  She explained the menu completely,  taking her time when we had questions, or looked overwhelmed (i have HORRIBLE anxiety in new places, so she was a big help)   Our order: we decide we're going to try a few things,  and share. We end up with spare ribs over badass fries, the catfish plate, and mac and cheese  GUYS. Bomb. As. Fuck.   Catfish was the best I've had in Vegas.  The fries were crispy,  and perfect. Im a dipper with fries (ranch, mostly) - i didn't use any sauce, they were good enough to not need any accompaniment.    I don't know what else to tell you here.  Friendly service,  great food, we'll 100% be back next week for Thursdays special.

b1Y2BcRVbz5PYo6tY_OAMw.text: So far, this is the best BBQ I've come across in the valley.  I ordered the Porkstar, which is a grilled cheese w/ chopped pork and their macaroni and cheese.  Absolutely AMAZING.  I checked in on Yelp! so I could get a free side.  Since I already had the macaroni on my sandwich, I decided to go for the potato salad.  Also equally amazing.  They put a jalapeno and onions on the side of your dish, so you can choose whether to pair it with your sandwich or not.  I loved every last bite.  I opted for sitting outside so I could bask in the desert heat.  The bread that it comes on is too thick for my liking, but it is extremely filling.    The staff are sweet and accommodating.  One thing I'd change is that there are no beer/alcoholic drinks, at least from what I gathered.   Other than that minor detail, this is a great spot and pricing is on point!

Y1Iyk_kbMJxWW46SGkLeMw.text: True story...  Since finding out about this place on Thursday (5 days ago) we've been to this spot 4 times!!! That's how freaking phenomenal this place is!!! There isn't anything about this spot that I don't like.  We came in and noticed that the special for Thursday's is the "Smack Daddy MAC and Cheese. It's a 5 cheese mac and cheese topped with burnt ends and fried jalapenos and my husband ordered the Texas Melt Sandwich. This food slaps and it slaps in a good way!!! I usually take pics of the food to post it along with my review but I totally forgot because I was in a trance with the smell of the food!! My husband and I didn't say a word... nothing, we didn't wanna talk and just wanted to enjoy our food.   Let's jump to the very next day which was Friday (day 2). I got out of work early and I called my husband to see if he wanted to sneak away for lunch, we both had the same thought because we both agreed to go back to Sin City Smokers. So Friday they have the "Full Rack Friday" it's a large serving, it has always 10 bones and my husband went for the brisket sandwich. You know the food is going to be good when you can smell the wood!  The meat was so tender and juicy that it would fall off the bone! I love being able to distinguish the different spices and when I got a taste of oregano, it was over for me. I didn't wanna share with my husband no matter how good his sandwich looked.   Not kidding... we went back on Saturday... we couldn't stop taking about this place to my son that he had enough and said "I gotta go to this place" so there we go.. on out way back.. for the 3rd time!   At this point, the staff already recognized us and because they have a loyalty problem.. we just earned a free meal for our next visit. We ordered the Porkstar, the Whole Hog and The Texas Melt. Words can't describe how amazing these sandwiches taste, needless to say, my teenager is now on the same page as us and is now a huge fan.   So here we are... we broke our perfect attendance and didn't go on Sunday, but we definitely considered it. We'd seen signs around the restaurant about a Memorial Day special on Tri-Tip. We love Tri-Tip and if anyone was going to do it right, it was going to be this place.   My husband ordered the Tri-tip sandwich and I tried the Tri-Tip tacos and we decided that this was definitely our BBQ spot and won't try anywhere else..   Im kinda disappointed that I haven't taken a lot of pics to post, I get lost in the sauce and completely forget!

We orders the brisket tacos with everything and the pulled pork fries which come out like nachos and it is all to die for! They have sides that are actually flavorful and not watery cheap sides. t4oQDhD33gYzAmctQZY7Tg.text: I'm not one for writing bad reviews because I love to eat so I always want to have good food. I waited a couple of weeks to write this review probably because I just felt bad about it. After reading all the reviews on this restaurant I really wanted to check it out with my kids so we went on Father's Day. First let me say it's a neat little restaurant with a very cool kind of atmosphere. Though I did have a good time the food was just okay. Keep in mind this is my opinion because I know this place is loved by many locals. Upon walking in I see an amazing menu on the wall but am informed that the items I would like to eat are served on a day specific basis and that today's special is the Father's Day special of prime rib. Well okay, I happen to love prime rib and this is Father's Day so that's what I will have. I added a side of Smack-A-Roni Mac-n-Cheese because I'd heard such great things about it. Brittney and Jeremy both ordered beef brisket with mashed potatoes as I did and the Smack-A-Roni Mac-n-Cheese. Alex ordered the Whole Hog sandwich and Kelsey the Bad Ass Fries. We sat at a picnic style table with benches and the smiling friendly server brought us some warm pork skins. I've never been served pork skins in a restaurant before and I have to say that these were really pretty good. I realized as my prime rib was being placed in front of me in a tinfoil pie dish that they had never asked me how I would like it prepared. I was also expecting a cut of meat as you would get at any steak house or even buffet here in Las Vegas. Instead what I received was a pile of room temperature meat along with 3 quarter cup to maybe half cup sized plastic containers with green beans mashed potatoes and Mac-n-Cheese. The Smack-A-Roni Mac-n-Cheese tasted like regular macaroni and cheese with crushed Cheez-It crackers piled on top. The prime rib was room temperature, full of fat and I was given plastic utensils to cut it with. The mashed potatoes were dense and stuffed into the container and also room temperature. I believe the warmest side order on my plate or in my tin where the green beans and the macaroni and cheese. I don't want to say that the food was bad because it wasn't it just wasn't great and I wish it was warm as it just come off the grill or oven or BBQ or however it is prepared but it wasn't. Brittney and Jeremy did not even finish their plates and these are two kids that absolutely love BBQ. The barbecue sauce that came with their dinners had a very strong chemical aftertaste and the barbecue sauce that we got from the bar tasted like a vinegar hot sauce you would get on chicken wings. Not exactly the barbecue flavor we were looking for. Kelsey's Bad Ass Fries tasted really good but after a few bites you would also get that chemical aftertaste of the barbecue sauce that was on them. Alex however loved his Whole Hog sandwich and downed it at record speed. I wasn't going to write this review, as a matter of fact I was just going to skip it altogether but as I've sat and thought about it I remember sitting with my food hearing the proprietor discussing with someone how he wasn't going to sacrifice the quality of his food yet there I sat with a pie tin full of fat and room temperature meat and a plastic knife to cut it with.The Au Jus really wasn't even warm. Now I'm not here to be negative about any restaurant and at some point I will probably go back and try something else because I know that there are good and bad days at any establishment. I just wish on Father's Day it would have been a better experience. Check out the video! youtu.be/xPpsuT3R5ts

oCAPutfed_Z7DNV7gVxmSw.text: Sin City Smokers catered my 35th birthday and it was AMAZING!  My 30+ guests loved the brisket and mac n cheese especially, but everything was so delicious.  Peach cobbler melted in our mouths and that was icing on my cake.  Steve, the owner, was very kind and followed up immediately. rOpZsVSGG_mqHc05m1W9JQ.text: My love language is brisket and Sin City Smokers knows what they're doing with my meat! I've been by a couple of times to try a few different dishes but my go-to protein is the brisket. There's only a couple of places in town to get this cooked well and SCS offers the most variety of preparation. Check their IG for daily specials, like fried catfish and turkey around the holidays.  PLATES: Your choice of meats and sides, in addition to brisket their hot links have a good kick and snap. Their mac is definitely my preferred side but their beans are also solid.   SANDWICHES: The Texas Melt is my favorite thing here, so crave-worthy. Plenty of thick, fatty brisket topped with pepper jack, roasted peppers, onions, and sauce. It's a huge portion and super messy, but oh so good. Trying another sando next time!  SPECIALS: The Big Daddy Mac is definitely a dish to share, thanks to the load of FIVE cheeses. It's nicely balanced with a bit of brisket and a fried jalapeno topping for contrast. I'm not a huge barbecue chicken fan (because it's often dry), but the tacos here are loaded with flavor, sauce, and slaw.   LOCATION: A little tricky to find and likely often confused with another BBQ joint in the next plaza but well worth seeking out. Staff are friendly and attentive, love the rustic decor. Wish this spot weren't so far for me, would definitely come regularly to make my way through the menu- baked potatoes, brisket quesadilla, and tamales are on my list to try.

RsWdJUX7X5fz218fuPH4mQ.text: A tasty Vegas example of a local family run restaurant. Walk into a fun looking BBQ joint, past all their trophies straight to the cashier. Put your order in, SHOW YOUR YELP CHECK IN FOR A FREE SIDE, pay, then wait for your smoked yumminess to be served in a foil bowl.  What makes it special is the slaw has dill herbs in it, the mild green whole pepper is smoked, the mac salad has cheese crunchies on it and the chix, brisket and catfish was juicy and soft.   When done, bring your tray next to cashier to throw out empty items.  Oh yeah, they have cobblers, too.

nya_HnQfhP2B8gb-jM-EOw.text: Can I just say, this place has got it going on! I took up a friend's recommendation. I am a fan of BBQ but haven't really had any that I would make as a regular spot. I've been to a few spots and was not impressed but not disappointed. This place on the other hand, I was very impressed with the selections and the flavors!  I usually can not decide on what to order, because everything looks so damn good. Being indecisive, I was able to order a5-meat platter! Yup this entree had 5 types of meats and two sides! Heck yah I was able to order something where I could try all of the meats I wanted on one plate. My overall favorite was the brisket, it was so soft and juicy- the bbq sauce made it 100x's better, I literally was in heaven. I can't wait to come back and try the signature sandwiches!

q-NVI2583M26oJt8fJnA0Q.text: Would give 0 stars if I could! Cool vibe but lacking on the drink stand area, it was a mess and very sticky.   I went in to order my lunch. Asked for lean meat and they have me the most marble piece of brisket they had! Then when they attempted to correct my order, they spoke loudly about me in the back, making sure I heard every word of how this is "how it is and that it doesn't get leaner that what it is"... anyways they came back with attempt #2 and tried to hide all the marble on the bottom of he sandwich.  Absolutely the most unprofessional bunch of people!  They certainly showed that they know what I was talking about since my top sliced where lean... but then why put all the fat at the bottom of my sandwich?!?! Just to be vindictive? All I wanted was to have lunch and these clowns just wanted to be pests!  I asked for my money back and they wanted to charge me for the sides which I gave them back. Such pettiness! This place was an absolute disappointment!   Find another BBQ spot!

QD3xZUc4eqGt3hLU_fMLFQ.text: Been here three times now, and haven't been disappointed once! Good food, good prices, great specials, what's not to love?  First time tried out the 3 Meats Platter for my girl and I. Brisket, Pork, and Hot Links with a side for under $20 was ab amazing deal and it was the best lunch we had in a long time.  Was so nice I brought family over for the second visit and now taking home even more goodness for the third trip. Protip: The Big Daddy Platter is a wonderful deal! 5 meats, two sides, and toast for $27 after tax. Can't get that anywhere else!  Highly recommend for those looking for cheap, good, local BBQ!

m4X6cK1V_4zwW1mj8HC1DQ.text: Ok Folks!!! Let's talk BBQ. I saw this place in postmates delivery section. It's  Friday and was wanting BBQ!!! I Ordered the Brisket and a add on of dill slaw. Let's talk taste. I do love the crust but 2 of the 3 slices weren't that tender. But pretty good flavor overall for the brisket. The dill slaw is just bad. No dill flavor, old lettuce with whatever you call the sauce that was on it. Just mayo would have been better. I took 2 bites and threw it away. With delivery fee and tax I paid $22. Not worth it. Good luck Sin City Smokers!!!

lg88HfNHDGVBRPAV7z3hgw.text: Placing an order for an office of 20, day of is tough enough but they helped me out and it was delicious!!!! The 5 cheese Mac and cheese was amazing!!! I can't wait to try the ribs, definitely going back!

xPqF1kvg1b6EgN9nqzrqKw.text: Yummy!!! This is the place to go for barbecue!!! Put all the others to shame!!! Meat falls off the bone, so tender and juicy!! 4lktCuZILfglJIZZuNh4Eg.text: Hands down the best BBQ joint in Vegas. Ribs are tender with good smoke (maybe add a little), flavorful sauce without being too sweet. Slaw is excellent and I don't even like Dill Slaw...but I do now! This slaw is perfect! Sin City Smokers can compete on a national level with Q from across the country and be proud! This is a first for Vegas (Henderson). You will not be disappointed by trying their meats! 100% recommended.

ISE8DhaD8y60POGvnG0m6w.text: Three of us came in and the cashier was standoffish and straight to the point. Directed us to the wall menu and stood still while two of us decided what we were going to eat. I was turned off immediately due to her body language and therefore, did not order. I seen the yelp sign stating that if you log in you'll receive a free side. As we're logging in  she  becomes impatient, tapping her pen against the palm of her hand, which really disturb me. I've seen so many positive reviews about this place and that's why we were interested in trying it out. Then another party of three arrived after my party completed their order and just like us, it was their first time visiting the establishment and once she established a rapport with them she became a bright shining star. She explained everything and we learned about the company via the next customers. She explained the specials, the wall menu, the easier menu that was posted right in front of the register WOW???... just think instead of having to bob and weave just you read a menu!!! Now the young lady that was next to the cashier was just the opposite - thank you for that!  Perhaps, if my complexion was a different shade my service would have also made the cashier a shining star towards us!!! Guess, I'll never be able to taste their BBQ due to her unprofessionalism.

hbpV0FijR_GYOQ2M0SzvEQ.text: I normally give good reviews however I feel as though I was not given exceptional, great, ok or even mediocre service today I've never been to this establishment before therefore the ambience was new to me. Once I decided on my order another group came in and right away they recieved warm and friendly customer service and were explained the menu in detail. I will not be back. If your black this may not be the establishment for you.

OHiGEPAP0yF4pxVfJ3EY7g.text: This is by far the Best BBQ in Las Vegas! Beautiful restaurant, great staff. Amazingly fantastic BBQ. Worth the drive,from any where in Vegas.

rCHA5D8-98QM138DWWHO-Q.text: Sin City Smokers! I can't say enough good things about the food, the service, and the overall experience of working with this company. The new hubs and I decided to do it ourselves for our wedding over Memorial Day weekend. I contacted a bunch of places, as we weren't sure what kind of meal we wanted, but we knew our budget. Christie's reply was prompt and professional, we met shortly after for a tasting at their Henderson location. She gave us a number of options to fit our budget (120-150 wedding guests) which included service, entrees, sides, bread, and beverages on a per person basis. And the food!! - I took one bite of that juicy chicken, I wanted to slap my mama it was so good!   The contract was clear and unambiguous. The couple of times I did have questions before the big day, Christie was responsive and helpful.   The day of the wedding, they came in promptly and set up in the designated area. Service was flawless and everyone had more than enough to eat, with tons left over. As we surveyed the party, everyone was full and more than happy with the food. It was just what you want from a vendor on your wedding day - totally uneventful, professional, and polite - everything just worked!!! We (the tired bride and groom) feasted on the leftovers they thoughtfully packaged for us for the next couple of days.   All in all, this was the best day of my life and Christie and her team helped to make that happen. Thanks Sin City Smokers, looking forward to booking you for our next event! (and stopping in for dinner next time we find ourselves in Henderson)  - Mr. and Mrs. BerryWhite

KN3RxwaVb3WY0mUNpbMQ6w.text: Me and my family came here because we saw the announcement on the Vegas Weekly Magazine, which pictured the restaurant as the best BBQ place in town.  Here is my experience: we got there, the menu is on the wall, we had to order everything before we can seat. There's a paper towel roll on the table that you can't move, when the food comes, the only utensils they had to eat the BBQ are plastic and the food is served in "to go" containers. The dressing salads aren't as good as they should. Everything is A La Carte.  The meat was good, is the only reason why I put 3 stars, everything is terrible which should be reviewed by the owners and have it on their consideration.  I thing for the price we paid for the dinner, it's like a high-end restaurant for the price but eating at a fast food restaurant for the service. Do you imagine eating BBQ, Steak with a PLASTIC fork and knife??? We don't.   Not very happy at all, but at least we tried.

dDk2p19FC3I22KEH1SdeKg.text: SUCKS!  $20 And I leave still hungry,   3 slices of brisket and 5 slices of sausage and a very small cup of collard greens full of liquid.  I should have known why the place was empty.

aimozpCOBg7EpOtGKuScPg.text: We used Sin City Smokers for our company bar b que picnic.  It was delicious.  They brought so much food  we got to eat sumptously twice.   Highly recommended.

WhUGpfMIXwJbE8zlr4TkGg.text: These guys were great, the ribs and steaks were phenomenal and everything went smoothly.  I would definitely hire them again.  The guys were really nice, on time and very professional. 10/10

v082SBeQmCwV1OQiR8LvHQ.text: I have three words for the food here, legit legit legit!! I had the brisket plate with two sides, the smack & cheese and the beans, I also added a half pound of the smoked pork. First off the brisket was insane good, moist, fall apart with a great tasting bark. The pork was also great, more of a Carolina chopped style but still tasted fabulous. The beans are sweet which I like, they definitely don't taste like your typical Q place beans and I like that. Smack and cheese was good, it had crunched up cheeze it's on top and was really creamy. I am glad that a real Q joint has opened up near my house because I will definitely be a long time customer!

4IFCcOPUoY0bOZZp5f3AWA.text: I consider myself a barbecue prude and this place is absolutely fantastic. you gotta try the porkstar it's ridiculous. Had the Texas melt with brisket and it was just as good. Staff was really friendly also. These folks are really on to something here. I'll be back for sure.. ALOT.

msLJRHR2zkxfPHDpKnC4Cg.text: Had my first experience with Sin City Smokers today. The food was outstanding...especially the brisket and the mac & cheese. Also had the chicken which was moist and tasty. My friend enjoyed the ribs and baked beans too.  My only complaint is the portion sizes.  The brisket needed at least one more slice and the sides are too small. The place isn't cheap they need to provide at bit more food. I'll still go back many times.

cO3wBuOpyx_3Ji3JON-Z1Q.text: Best BBQ in Vegas!!! Hands down! There's no competition. I've had most of the BBQ here in the Vegas valley and there's nothing like a hearty meal at Sin City Smokers. One of a kind, unique,  and original. The perfect place to enjoy with your family. The atmosphere is so positive and the customer service is phenomenal. And the food!!! My god! Is too damn good not to taste! The meat is perfect! Seriously! And the rest of the food compliments the meat so well. The flavors are addicting! Big hearty portions and good prices. Make it how you want or try the daily and weekly specials. And if you don't know what you want, you can't go wrong with their signature sandwiches. The best. Period.You haven't had BBQ till you have had Sin City Smokers!

eLRy6BLk6xm713K4RhqDLQ.text: Pros... nice restaurant, front end lady was extremely helpful. Cons... very pricey for what you get (portions) and the BBQ wasn't spectacular... but will probably go back for a lunch special... one visit isn't enough to make a life-long decision!

ZOsVt6L1UlJHo_6xkr1x7A.text: Picked Sin City based on Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed!  Christie was responsive, friendly and helpful through the whole ordering process for catering (delivery) an event for my family.  Food was delivered on time. They brought plastic ware wrapped in napkins, plates, wipes and a plastic table cloth (which we didn't need). The ribs were amazing - the meat fell off the bone and it was not dry.  Extra BBQ and hot sauce provided.  The smoked BBQ beef was flavorful and tender.  The cornbread and biscuits - perfect, moist and delicious!  Everyone raved over the vinegar coleslaw. The salad was fresh, provided with ranch and Italian dressing.  Roasted vegetables, mashed potatoes - very good.  But the red beans with rice? Mouth watering. We were afraid the fruit trifle would be too sweet but it was not - every single dish was thoroughly enjoyed.  Thank you, Sin City!  We will definitely be eating here again the next time we are in Vegas!

Q6BbF1vZpshBaIiEgl7T8w.text: I went to Sin City Smokers for lunch yesterday. It wasn't the best BBQ I've had in Las Vegas, but it wasn't horrible.   The staff was very friendly, smiles all around. It seemed to be that they had some regular customers in the restaurant when I was there.   Food: I ordered the rib plate and added 2 sides (cole slaw and beans) and a water. $21 for lunch. A little pricey, but I gave it a shot. Ribs were St. Louis cut, 4 bones and garnish of onion and a jalapeno were included. The bones weren't cut through and I was unable to cut them with my plastic knife; the kitchen had to cut them through for me. Ribs were OK, a bit fatty. The sides tasted great, but it was a SMALL portion for what you paid ($2 each).   Will I go back again, probably. But I'll try something else next time.

8_GZ3Pk9Jv9AgNFGusIFvA.text: I am not a bbq fan but let me tell you eating here has changed my ways. It was absolutely AMAZING! The service and staff was excellent. The food was even better. Fresh and good taste. You can tell everything was made fresh!!

ptC5pCRoOIIEZb6pjvZBxg.text: This is the best Texas bbq in all of the valley. This is real Texas bbq. Not like the "other" places that claim to be Texas bbq. This is the real deal. The owner, Steve is a pleasure to talk to. The brisket is awesome. We can't wait to return for a little taste of home.

AhWVUFJ1xgVTvhIaMwKiYg.text: I was looking for good bbq for my wedding reception. Steve completely surpassed my expectations! He made this Bride incredibly happy:) From the beginning to end he made everything so easy for me. We all know wedding planning is stressful, but knowing no matter what we'd have good food gave me piece of mind!   Now on to the food: The beef Brisket was to die for! I've honestly never had better. Such good flavor in the crust and very tender. Even the fatty parts were like butter. Mmmmmmmmm  The hot links, macaroni & cheese & Bourbon baked beans were a huge hit! Trust me! With my new family being from Louisiana they know their bbq and I can say everyone left happy!:)  I was even surprised when we got to take some leftovers back with us. They came so well prepared to handle my forever changing guest count lol I cant say how much we loved Steve and his Sin City Smoker crew. Thank you for making my wedding reception an amazing experience!

bLaPuooNxopxj5-AvzDdMQ.text: Stopped in for lunch. Most BBQ places in Henderson/Las Vegas seem to be closed on a Sunday, but these guys were open. Nice, clean place. Had the two meat combo (pork ribs/brisket). Both meats were tender, juicy and favorable.  They do serve beer and wine, so no BYO. I would very much recommend.

59SCNe7Yib5XPzdK4u9Emg.text: This was my first time here but my experience was great. When you walk in they have a display of all their awards for their great bbq. The place was Clean, staff was nice and helpful , music they were playing was great and best of all the bbq was awesome. I had their specialty Texas melt with their mac n cheese. One of the best brisket sandwiches I've had and their mac and cheese was really good too. The mac and cheese wasn't a huge portion but the sandwich was enough so it worked itself out. I will be back here again for sure.

b0VkrXXw4Y_8K-Zib-Vk6Q.text: My husband was told by a friend to check this place out, so we decided to try it.  First off I'll say, we're a bit picky when it comes to restaurants.  However, this super cute and quaint restaurant was very clean, so were the restrooms-a HUGE plus in our book!  Secondly, the owner Steve, is a BBQ champion, he has more trophies on display in the restaurant than you can shake a stick at.  We split the 'Big Daddy', (because we wanted to taste a little of everything), which is five smoked meats, 2 sides and Texas bread. OMG, the food was incredible and the sauces are to die for!  We had to restrain ourselves from eating it all and ended up bringing the leftovers home for dinner.  We're so happy we made the trip across town, it was definitely worth it!!  If you're looking for outstanding bbq/smoked food, look no further.

KTjQWHkX9IZGUcYzDLEkgA.text: I had the pulled pork tacos & HOLY MOLY they were amazing.   The meat & toppings were paired perfectly.  Other people at my table got the brisket plate, the spicy sausage plate & the special (ribs & wings).  Every single person went on & on about how amazing their food was.  We also had mac & cheese for a side.  It was topped with cheez its & also SOOO GOOD.  Highly recommend this place.  From the cleanliness, to the amazing customer service & the delicious food.  A+++ in all categories.

mAncvIgUX8920Tyr2ZfviA.text: Sin City Smokers sold me once my conversation with Christie began. She is an enthusiast extraordinaire, bright, cheery and on top of all of our needs and concerns. Her comforting assurance that my father's Celebration of Life would go smoothly, that they would feed all who attended, and could even stay later than planned to help out with any hungry stragglers if necessary, helped alleviate some of our stresses and brought buoyancy to the heavy situation at hand. After phoning my sister to let her know I'd found our caterer, she suggested a few changes to my menu choices. Without problem or hesitation, tweaks to the originally planned menu were made, and from burgers to chicken to German potato salad and grilled fresh, seasonal vegetables, all of the food was delicious. They supplied all the necessities: plates, utensils, napkins, condiments, and I was assured, too, they would clean up and vanquish all remnants of their presence, that we wouldn't even know they had been there, and True to their word, it was so. They did, however, leave all the excellent, leftover food - another blessing in a time of deep grief. Christie was there serving up kindness and smiles along with the spread, and griller Matt was amiable and skilled; they made the event all the more relaxed and cordial.  Thank you, Sin City Smokers,  for your excellent food and service and helping to make our dad's celebration a great success!

Q4_C_WKdMK7-XewlaBjiQQ.text: Stopped in again for some lunch. Got the brisket as a sandwich. The BBQ sauce is on point!!! I've already got my eyes on what I want next time. Support local BBQ!

cL3BganYM8c6DrZzuuSMQg.text: Had a fantastic meal here at the suggestion of a friend.  All of the meats and sauces that we tried were very good as were the sauces.  Will definitely come back when I am in Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious meats!

fNvHgPm_tCAtrFkzac39XA.text: I am unfortunately getting to this review a little bit later than I would have liked. Sin City Smokers catered my wedding which took place at an outdoor location back in April.   First: Picking our food and our setting was incredibly easy and affordable.   Second: they came fully prepared with all the necessary equipment, and tableware making the set up incredibly easy on us. The serving went off with out any problems whatsoever.  Third: (and most important) the food is excellent. The portions were great. The beef brisket was so popular, we had none left over. The sides were also great, especially the Mac N Cheese! We found that the portioning was almost spot on. We had just enough left over to enjoy.   Special thanks to Christie for helping with all of this and making it work out great.

DGhQ9Kems436Jr-z10sZRQ.text: The best BBQ I have had in Vegas!!! You have to try this little hidden gem  Two thumbs up!!!!!

R0exz9j8w9QfmrW5NvaCcg.text: This place is a True gem. I had a hankering for barbecue and asked a friend where I should go. He said check out the new place Sin City Smokers. I am so glad I went. I had the rib sandwich with spicy barbecue sauce and a side of potato salad. They chopped my ribs and placed them between two pieces of Texas Toast. Literally one of the best barbecue places I've been in quite some time. The owner, Steve, was very nice and is always there. I'm a BBQ Catering Owner and very picky about BBQ. Trust me, this place is great! Thanks Steve!

gYnpPgQT0hWu8fUdyQDqAw.text: Fantastic food!!! I am a big fan of" kitchen sink or junk yard fries" and their Bad ass fries are some of the best ive ever had!!! So flavorful and filling!!! Had the brisket with them and holy cow they are to die for!!! We have also tried the sandwiches, smoked chicken wings and big daddy Mac and cheese.... all were amazing!!! They have a great,  friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming  staff!!! When we went in for the second time one of the girls remembered us and our order from last time and made us feel like home!!! Great place for a great environment nice staff and incredible BBQ!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brisket Bad Ass fries and the Porkastrami sandwich.  Bad ass fries were to die for!!!!! Porkastrami was also delish!!

BPUjdpIdmcKpJrnQmkAYaw.text: First off...everything was spot on.  Before you order: after perusing the menu on the wall, be sure to take a glance down below the register...posted on the front of the bar/counter are three other menu items not listed with the others. One being the Big Daddy Platter for $25: five meats, two sides, two Texas toast.  Two of us shared 2 ribs (nice and lean, wonderfully tender), 4 brisket slices (also trimmed, nice and lean), sausage (hot links? tasty and flavorful), chicken, and pulled pork (not fatty, moist and yummy), beans and fries.    I decided to add the Special that day; BBQ Lasagna for $7. I know it sounds weird, but was amazingly addictive. It was definitely different, but we couldn't stop taking bites of it. I would call it a BBQ Casserole, though. :)  After throwing on a couple pieces of cornbread to boot, we stuffed ourselves silly, and still had more than half of almost everything to take home.  Everyone was super friendly and it felt very homey to eat in there. The decorations were eclectic and charming, including a quite full trophy case and oversized check from a competition won.  Unfortunately, we didn't see the desserts in the case until after we were done...or had any room for by that time...but we will make a point to try a couple the next time, because we will definitely be back!

6stNAKf0Y1bWovDM6LTAQw.text: I gave this place another shot and am happy I did.  Good food good people good deal.  This isn't Austin barbeque but but was good. Juicy brisket, sauce still wasn't anything to write home about, and the spicy one was too spicy for me. Crazy Mac and cheese made with a few different types of cheese. It had cheez-its in it which gave it a cool texture but I don't like cheez-its. So it won't be my choice next time. I would like it if they had a veggie side dish  They even had a veggie selection for my vegetarian friend! Who said the veggie quesadilla was amazing!  I'm going back Wednesday for their baked potato special. $9 and sounds pretty good!

nJ4ASGqr94HeFH4QtiWwbg.text: Sorry Rollin Smoke and Big B's there's some new BBQ in town!!!  What y'all know about pulled pork and Mac n cheese on a sandwich.....Sin City Smokers knows!!!! Along with the brisket and baby backs and greens and baked beans I think we had more food than that but I'm in a food coma!!! We drove from Mnt Edge to try this place and I'm glad we did!!! Looks like I'm gonna have to make the drive to Green Valley more often because here is definitely more food I want to try here!!!  Wonderful!!!

iWAiVFnFAV3sCGZ1pMp3sA.text: This place has a fantastic atmosphere, very friendly staff. The food was delicious and portions were big. Will definitely be back.

92kFdgg850LfTA7ZFAP4jg.text: Delicious BBQ, great atmosphere, and wonderful, friendly staff. Whatever you order, you won't be disappointed!!

PLN-dqsR3kqvvEMpssyeaA.text: I'll start with the good because I love to see small businesses succeed, and just because it wasn't my cup of tea doesn't mean you won't love it.  The aroma is out of this world, wafting into the parking lot, it hits your nose like a ton of bricks, in the most delicious way possible.  The atmosphere is very comfortable especially for a bbq joint.  Casual sit-down. Nice decor.   The service is very friendly! I ordered online via yelp and the blonde who greeted me when I picked it up was vert nice and even let me use the yelp check-in to add a free small side to my already-completed order!   They got the order correct and accomodated all my requests (cut sammich in half, sauce on the side, etc)  Brisket was tender.  The bbq sauce itself is delicious!  I really like the sweet bbq!  They put a bunch of dif flavors in the bag so I could sample them all! That really made me happy!  Now to what I didn't like.  Again, keep in mind that everyones tastes are different.  I am simply writing my personal take on the food.  Food was very greasy. I understand bbq isn't exactly health food.  And I am by no means a health nut.  But when the flavor and mouthfeel of grease is what stands out in a dish, it takes away from the experience.   The food was missing that "wow" factor.  I can't place my finger on it but it just didn't "hit the spot" for me. I ate the food, but I found myself wishing I'd gotten something else.   Maybe other items of theirs are more up my alley.  Give it a try for yourself! I hope you love it.

9AUCgBHdzwlpr0xOaBAeew.text: Wow! I went in there hungry and was really craving bbq brisket. Beyond expectation with their food. The bad ass fries were top notch! Brisket on point! All around my Ohana and I were very impressed. Delicious food and we will be returning for sure.

OyYrhILI5yqvtBtc2z1Z0A.text: If you want the BEST BBQ in Metro Las Vegas then Sin City Smokers is the place to go. Steve knows how to prepare your meal to high-quality standards and beyond. Also if you're a pro 2A guy and an NVFAC (Nevada Firearms Coalition) member, you will get a discount that will make you feel like a VIP. :)

ecyvHgR7oytPPiZFG8H1Bg.text: Had heard good things so decided to give it a try. We were impressed with the layout and atmosphere and menu choices. The meat is top notch as the brisket had a good bark and just right amount of smoke and rub. Pulled pork was moist and had a great flavor. All in all very good barbecue with average pricing for what you get. Staff is very friendly and only issue is that the server had to cover the register as well which left a few plates like ours sitting a little longer in the pick up window then I would like. Other then that it's a good choice for good bbq.

nfWXDSnz5z1-Md8-CuZeeA.text: Environment is great, employees are awesome. Restaurant is clean and gives that type of picnic feel, love it. BUT, my food was luke warm, the portion size of the sides for the price was not worth it. It my food was hot maybe a different review. I went for the baked potato but they only serve on a certain day. Ask for the mac n cheese, yup only served on a certain day. Menu is limitec not a huge selection.

xShPGEqj6TuVGn5G1DIyNw.text: A must try BBQ joint that serves up some legit BBQ with a twist...heard about their Thursday Special the Big Daddy Mac which is 5 cheese Smack-a-Roni, topped w/Burnt Ends, more cheese, and deep fried jalapenos...and I knew I had to go...I must admit it was Smack Daddy Delicious...although I couldn't even finish a quarter of it which was alright because it reheats nicely...I also tried a couple sides...jalapeno potato salad (nice and creamy with a little kick to it), maple bacon baked beans (tasted like pancakes), smack-a-roni (the topped cheese-its are awesome), corn bread (oh so moist)...I thought I already found the best BBQ in Vegas but now after trying Sin City Smokers I'm conflicted since I already can't wait to try their ribs, BBQ tamales, tacos, and bad ass fries.

o4fnYz_VTufyPpI3HMb9cQ.text: After driving past it a few times I finally found Sin City smokers. It is a few blocks from where I work and I was excited to see a new place in the area, especially some BBQ. I entered the place and went to the front to look at the menu on the wall. I saw what I wanted and waited by the register for a few minutes until someone came out from the back. They were kind enough to explain some of the options on the menu and I placed my order.   I went with the Brisket ( a 1/4 lb) and it came with raw onions and a pepper. I really just wanted meat, raw onions are not appetizing to me  but the grilled pepper had some nice flavors. I also had a 1/2 rack of ribs. The ribs were decent, nothing out of this world or something I would go back for. The brisket was dry and I was thankful they put sauce in my bag so it was more edible. It did have a nice outer crust and smoke ring, just not juicy as I have had it elsewhere. Looking at the different sides I went with the mac and cheese, they call it another name but that's what it was. It was a super small portion, a few bites and there is a cheese it on top. I see all the trophies when walking in and I hope they do well here but I would not be a return customer.

_iNLFLHHysr3K074O02r7Q.text: Sin City Smokers is Hot & New.  Actually, they're not new to Las Vegas.  Sin City Smokers is known around town as one of the best BBQ catering businesses in Las Vegas.  They're also known throughout the country and have placed 1st place for "Best Ribs" a ton of times.  Check out their trophy cage located inside their restaurant.  It's pretty impressive.   I heard rumors over a year ago that Sin City Smokers was planning on opening a restaurant in Las Vegas.  And finally, they're here.  Sin City Smokers is known for their ribs, but it's the brisket that brought me here.  If they have good ribs, they must have a good brisket too.  Besides, I usually skip pork and not a huge ribs guy.  The menu isn't stacked like the rest of the BBQ restaurants in town.  Their meats consist of ribs, hot links, BBQ chicken, and brisket.  Pick your meat and then choose how you want it served.  I chose to have the brisket with their Texas toast.  I have to admit, the brisket is one of the best that I've had in Las Vegas.  The brisket was a combination of fatty and lean, which is just how I like it. It was also tender and had that smoked flavor to it.  It's a good thing that the brisket was good because the Texas toast was a little dry.  The brisket was so good that I ended up eating it by itself with no sauces.  If I had an issue with their brisket, it's the portion size.  I got about 6 oz. of brisket for $9.99.  Additional sides are $2 and I got their Maple Bacon Baked Beans.  This was pretty good.  I just thought it was a little small (less than a cup) for the price.    Overall, I have mixed feelings about Sin City Smokers.  Las Vegas has a lot of BBQ restaurants in town, especially in Henderson.  For the price I paid, I'm used to getting about 8 oz. of meat, sometimes two different types, and two sides.  Also keep in mind that they don't hook it up here.  The menu is also missing beef ribs, tri-tip, burnt ends, turkey, etc.  I'm not saying they don't have it or can't make it.  It's just not on their menu.  The sides for $2 each are on the smaller side too.  But then again, I didn't get what they're known for and that's their ribs.  The reason for the 4 star review is because their brisket is so good and worth coming back for. I just wish the portions, including their sides, are a little bigger.    TIP #1: Located off Green Valley and Sunset, where Sumo Sushi used to be located.  TIP #2: Check out their Weekly Specials.   TIP #3: Signature Sandwiches also on the menu (3 pork sandwiches / 1 beef sandwich)

-Ilzw3a7mipIb77_YldfXA.text: Such a fun, cool atmosphere in vibe. Seriously, the best brisket I've had ! Literally melts in your mouth. Also, the decor is so fun , unique and chill and I LOVE that they show support for our men & woman in law enforcement!

1qIWGOcqGklQxI3FLbQMgA.text: Best BBQ My wife and I have ever had! I ate the hot links, BBQ Chicken, and pork Combo and My wife had the brisket Tacos.  Both meals were perfectly cooked, had amazing flavor and incredible sauce. The baked beans and Dil slaw was great as well.. I recommend this to everyone! Make this place your next meal out. The only issue You will have is putting your fork down!

908-zw6qQthiVANCzg3Rag.text: Always a great meal here! Some of the best BBQ in Vegas IMO. If you come during a Golden Nights game they have 2 for 1 beers on select brands. Come supper this local BBQ joint, you will bring saying "Praise the Lard" as you finish your meal!

O-p2ohAn3KQ6plVkP-oIYw.text: I can't talk about this place enough. It is pretty much a weekly staple for us. The porkstar is so freaking good, and the brisket is just ughhh. amazing. Gotta love that Smackaroni (mac and cheese). I live for the daily lunch specials on Facebook. We typically eat here once and week, and I've also ordered food for potluck at work and no one is ever disappointed. This is a family owned spot, and you will likely see the Dad (owner) when you visit. He is super friendly and approachable and dang passionate about his food! We recommend this place any chance we get, and go here as often as we can! Prices are great for the portions you get. I've yet to be disappointed and I'm salivating just writing this. The staff is friendly and it is always a peaceful environment to eat. Love all the decor on the wall and the smell when you walk up is heavenly!

E5672UdtE8iKey_K2RS7xw.text: Wow , just wow ! Fast service and very reasonable prices. I had the Brisket, it tender and delicious, 2 other  people  had the pork pastrami sandwich , they said it was great . The employees are so nice and friendly in this relaxed atmosphere. Location is so easy to find , at the corner of Sunset and Green Valley. Plenty of parking. We will be back ......

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yvNDNkLUv6n4OKUGNWz38w.text: Five friends and I had lunch at Sin City smokers yesterday and absolutely raved about it. The ribs were  fall off the bone tender,  juicy and melted in your mouth. Same with their excellent brisket. My friend had the smoked sausage with beans and rice and while I didn't care for the beans and rice she gave me a couple pieces of her sausage because she has a very small appetite and I swear it was  some of the best smoked sausage I've ever eaten. On my way out I stopped and got a carry out order of  sausage  so I could freeze for later.  I had read so much on Yelp about the maple baked beans and I have to admit they were terrific.  The service is excellent by some of nicest people.   You order at the counter and they bring it to you. The place is very rustic and very "down home". Everything is served in plastic and aluminum containers but who cares... the food was outstanding. So glad we found this place and we know we're going to be back before long.  Oh those awesome ribs!!

Do8qwJUIuxsZRqM39zeXDg.text: Okay so this is about a month late so shame on me.  This place is good. Like really good. I happened to find it because of heading to a golf course and thought I'd give it a try.  I was recommended the brisket melt and it did not disappoint.  I would highly suggest this to anyone going to give that sandwich a go.  It had great flavor and just the right amount of moisture within the brisket.  The bread had a nice crisp crunch that you would expect from a proper melt.    I would totally make every attempt to come back and eat here whenever I'm back in Vegas.  A bit off the strip however it's exactly what I was looking for which would make it more of something the locals would eat.

TSEiV2MFuzzzjflzvduC6w.text: Great food. Cool vibe. I liked the pork ribs the best, my boyfriend liked the hot links. Best side was the maple baked beans, crazy good.

_eGoa2nZEMb9_O_s9T3mfg.text: Place is super cute upon first entering and staff is more than helpful when ordering (as it was my family's first time here) we got a little bit of everything off the sides and I can't say a negative thing yet ! Portions were generous and were very quick coming out of the kitchen! Hat off to sin city smokers, you'll see this family again !!

sdnxHotgrBDX92bhy5h-oQ.text: Read about Sin City Smokers in the Las Vegas Weekly this week & had to try it out. My friend Steve came with me & we both agree this is our new regular BBQ spot! Had the porkstar for lunch which is a pulled pork Mac & cheese sandwich. So good!!! I was full after the 1st half, but it's so delicious I ate the whole thing. With daily & weekly specials to try. I will be coming back for a long time to come. The staff was also friendly.

4BQ0RKYOcU5UpImFIQAGdw.text: We went in tonight after reading the great reviews. We love to support small business and usually stay off of the strip. The hostess was exceptional. She was friendly and informative.  The flavor of the meat was yummy! We each ordered 2 meat plates with sides. We were expecting enough food to have left over, but we left hungry. The mac was smaller than we assumed too. The collards were watery and flavorless and my sweet potato was fair. We left bummed that after $50.00 including the tip that we did not find value. We did not mention it at the time because they had customers walk in when we were leaving.

trePN4LVtPEHNOejrWRU5g.text: My husband went to get bbq for us to eat while watching the Super Bowl. We saw great reviews for Sin City Smokers and so he went there first. Silly me, I needed to call in my order for brisket days before. But he did come home with some ribs. They were big and meaty and covered in just enough bbq sauce. They were amazing! So my husband also stopped off at Famous Dave's to get the brisket I was craving. He spent way too much money and the food was not that good. We cannot wait to go back to Sin City Smokers to have their ribs again, and if their brisket is just as good we have a new favorite here in Henderson.

uHwKUqZcBVUcTjOLcPuzNQ.text: Their food is amazing! They catered a luncheon for our staff of a hundred people. The food was so fresh and the flavors were delicious. My staff really could not stop talking about the quality of the food. They were on time and the delivery was top notch. They also set up. I will be using them for many more events.

CNoZqbODkg7Yc_OszIuFhg.text: Limited choice of potato salad is a bad start (with jalapenos). Only ONE side with a 2 meat plate is skimpy and forces you to buy another side.   Meat was better than average. Brisket fell apart, but too much grizzle; links spicy, but amount of meat for a two meat plate was skimpy. NO bread served.   $22 with a drink seems pricey. Got iced tea and shocked to find NO SWEETNER except sugar in a jar and there's only one jar for the entire restaurant.  On day I was there it was 89 outside and a/c was not on inside.   Friendly helpful staff though. Funny how bbq places never seem to get it all quite right.   Would not go out of my way to visit again but it's ok in a pinch if you're close by.

c7__CV_Id9mGIMsidMI_aA.text: Now this was my first time and I got it to go, I'm willing to give them another try.  Loved the restaurant, the decor, the 2nd amendment flags, the raw wood. Everything was clean. The girl that helped me was super helpful and friendly, give that girl a raise! So the baby back ribs were good but not sure if it was because it was their Friday special, but the rib meat seemed scant on those bones. But they were tasty and I even liked the sauce, I am very picky with my sauce so I was pleasantly suprised. I tried some Mac and cheese with the cute cheese nip topping, it didn't do it for me, it was very bland, very plain. Then some cornbread, huge pieces, that tasted great but was terribly dry and crumbly. I grabbed a cheesecake from their fridge before I left, I can't pass up dessert. Well, I wish I wouldn't have...you may like it but it was too "cheesy", not enough sweetness. I'd get their meat again for sure, skip the rest.

Down side is more than once I listened to the manager rant while customers where present  disaspponting to listen too when trying to enjoy the meal.  Will not spend another dime at this location.

KsL2wnO9MgA6dPe3xmgyjg.text: Three words: a-maze-ing! Consistently great food!, very friendly staff, adorable decor.

bx__Uwtkc02aoEZDAE-LsQ.text: Really, really excellent BBQ. We ate there last night after checking them out on Yelp.  Super friendly and attentive  cashier/waitress, nice decor (patriotic! I loved it), lots of the owner's awards on display.   Highly recommended.

8xTHrMQKG1gZcm_cSMXmWg.text: We came in to order some food to go for the fam.  I loved the feel of the restaurant.  There are tons of BBQ trophies and awards.  It really feels like a family spot.  The menu is cool you pick the meat (or veggie) you want and then how you want it, plated, sandwich, taco, fries, quesadilla, etc.  Since we were ordering for several of us we opted to order by the pound.  We ordered 1 rack of spare ribs, 1/4 lb brisket, 2 hot links (we were told 2 links = 1/2lb), veggie plate, quart of mac and cheese, quart of potato salad, 3 corn bread and a sweet tea.  Our total before tip was just under $100.  Price was around what we normally spend when getting bbq so that wasn't an issue.  Food was good.  It just didn't blow anyone away.   Didn't seem like we got 2 hotlinks but maybe it was a 1/2 lb and that is closest to 2 links.  Hot links were our favorite part of the meal.  I could have done without all the onions, peppers, jalapeno, etc, that in some form was on every meat.  It didn't affect the taste of the meat that I could tell.  It was more of a garnish.  Maybe it is a regional thing?  I think the hot links had more veggies than the veggie plate.  Mac and cheese was topped with Cheez-Its that was a nice touch.  The potato salad had jalapenos but wasn't spicy (that is not a complaint just fyi).  The cornbread was sweet and had great taste but was extremely dry.  Their house made bbq sauces were really good.  They have a regular and spicy.  They had several puddings in the drink case.  On the day we were there they had banana pudding, peanut butter and jelly (with nutter butters!) and a third I can't remember maybe funfetti or something like that.  When we got home we wished we would have gotten them.    They have daily specials that look great red beans and rice, bbq tamales and what I am most looking forward to full rack of baby back ribs on Fridays.  I will def be back for that and hopefully update my review.

Q0i8Wwmh0vswUxdmLr-z3g.text: Stopped in for a quick bite, the food was amazing.  We got the Big daddy plate which fed 3 of us. The food was tender,  the sides were excellent. Especially the mac n cheese. Yummy.

Njz2ochJNai6lsPGK1rumg.text: I had to walk out because I don't understand their system. They have servers or a waitress staff of some sort,  but they aren't helpful. My 1st and only visit some cook or chef had to come out of the kitchen to greet at the counter after I was standing there for 5 minutes. I got too much info too fast and was handed a paper take out looking menu. I asked the waitress or cashier that was at the counter I I can take time to go over this menu,  she said sure have a seat she'll take care of me.  I sat at a table for 30 minutes confused by this menu and I had questions but no-one came to my table. A couple walked in sat down behind my table ordered and was served  in 15 minutes while I was still sitting after 39 minutes.  So I walked out. I don't know how the food tastes but that's the worst service I've ever experienced in a dine in restaurant in my life.

IfOCrx9hPitWSTT6oc36JA.text: Whelp , went here with a family of five looking for a good barbecue spot. What we got was a whole lot of fat, skimpy meat with marginal flavor that's terribly overpriced. Wanted a sample of different meats like most places have; they don't offer any. Everything is al la carte. Menu says $2 for sides then they show you that the $2 price is literally a tablespoon so you'll need to pay $6.99 for a pint or $11.99 for a quart of one side. No mashed potatoes, very limited selection. Ordered their "Bad ass fries" and received these plain ass fries with nothing as advertised (picture). I ordered to go so I didn't check my food until I made it home and was pissed. Underwhelming and disappointed is an understatement.  My nine year old summed it up best with " Dad, I don't really taste much meat so I'm just dipping it in the sauce". My thoughts exactly. Severely Overpriced. Don't waste you time nor money. I would've glad shelled out more elsewhere. This puny portion set me back $70! Never again

Z6W1inkNuAOYbODeE2fOnQ.text: I really like their food. This was my second time in and it's very good. I can say that it's the best in the Henderson area!

uVHnVusZHCyF7oIcfXXDCA.text: First time trying Sin City Smoke and it was delicious. The sauce was amazing and the brisket was cooked perfectly. Other things of note was: I also really liked seeing the owner cooking in the back, not always possible but I always feel the food is better when the owner is at the helm. Also the decor was comfortable, clean and gave a good vibe.

qp9_yXJOkgpnKl2HhGgIzQ.text: Staff was very friendly on arrival. Placed order and food came pretty quick.  Very good BBQ flavor in the sandwich and the Mac and cheese like is said. Wow.   Will definitely be back to try something else.

Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 Cheese Smackoroni. One word. Wow.
Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Saturday special. Porkstrami sandwich.  And yes it was very tasty.  The mustard sauce is amazing.

CqfIlnjYaTeHcs3oRv2rYg.text: The ribs were good, but putting ray onions with it seemed strange, plus a big pepper was odd. took much too long to get the food.  How hard is it too get 4 ribs on a plate, which was a container only for an in house meal. Pretty sad.

JL_oOsRDowtFIk18CQX-3w.text: Sin City Smokers BBQ is probably the best BBQ I have ever eaten. The menu has something for everyone, the staff was attentive and very friendly, and the food was awesome. The facility is very clean, music is outstanding and ambiance is very welcoming. If I could rate 10 stars I would.  My wife had the brisket sandwich with sides of five cheese smack-a-roni and baked beans. WOW! The adventurous type that I am dined on the brisket quesadilla. OMG! The iced tea is fresh and the portions are H U G E. Enjoy!

yeDfOMJEHO9TKWbfruGdPg.text: Sin City smokers has some of the Beef Brisket I've ever had. I also a side of Mac N Cheese which was amazing. The Brisket is smoked perfectly and seasoned just right. Also tried two different sauces both of which are good. One was spicy and the other was sweet. Either one is a good pick.  The staff was extremely polite, and the restaurant was clean. I will defiantly be returning back to try other menu items.

etjBP6p2Ke5UZnQRDncSlw.text: Great Southern BBQ the place is very cute and the service was really good. Brisket is very moist and delicious.  The ribs are excellent.  Their sides are wonderful especially the potato salad and coleslaw.  Pulled pork is out of this world. You should really give them a try!!!

X0JBaa0ay4f4ygv-lDwJbg.text: Sin City Smokers catered our recent team event of 40 people. I cannot stress strongly enough how great Steve, Christie and the whole SCS team were to work with. First and foremost, the food was absolutely outstanding. Everyone on our team was raving about how delicious all of the food was. Many commented that it was the best BBQ they've ever had. Second, SCS did a fantastic job serving the food to our team in a friendly and professional way. On the day of the event, the setup, service and clean up was attentive, thorough and without issue. Finally, SCS were extremely professional before, during and after the event. We are completely satisfied with SCS and won't hesitate to cater with them for another event. I will recommend them to anyone who is interested.

CMFvjznOFiAkE-OvwI5VeQ.text: Great bbq! brisket was the best i have ever had . The mac and cheese was creamy , cheesee, with a little crunch on top, sweet beans were like candy just the way they should be. Golden nuggets were tasty and and fried pb&j top me off for a great dessert. The staf was freindly and helpful . We will be returning alot.

xnoBd5jRXfmR_xTQ5rzZUQ.text: Delicious.. whole hog is an awesome sandwich! Will do again.. Mac and cheese so good.

0GfGMt-M74BryOQGd1MfxQ.text: If I could give them 6 stars I would.  The food is phenomenal and well worth the price.  All the meats are tender and juicy.  The sauce and rubs they use are flavorful and not too salty.  The service is awesome and everyone who works there is extremely helpful.  If you want BBQ, GO HERE!

dWzZhddsT8cV_WLWInx8Cg.text: Immaculately clean and an awesome friendly and knowledgeable staff!! Now for the good stuff!! Brisket was off the chain!! Perfectly smokey, great salt and pepper flavor on the bark and the rest was beefy deliciousness!! Hot links were spicy but not over powering and had a solid texture not over cooked and sitting around all day like some places. Baby backs had the perfect competition style bite through and great flavor. My wife loved her whole hog sammich... sides were good, my wife loved the Mac and beans were too sweet for my taste. (But I didn't come here for sides).  This guy is the best kept bbq secret in Vegas and it won't be long before lines are out the door!!

G4E3vlbYYaur4n_aGE_fpw.text: Yummy  Awesome brisket all BBQ is amazing

jYVwKttpJRPkJk3s4aTKgA.text: Best barbecue in Las Vegas! Definitely need to try the Texas Melt and the Bad Ass Fries!! Highly recommend stopping by! The owners treat you like family and the food is so fresh and yummy.

photos.caption: Photo of Sin City Smokers Barbecue and Catering - Las Vegas, NV, United States

44bX1Y96Ea5mlPYf8Mijpw.text: Went there after having their food at a catered event.  The food at the event was very good and very flavorful.  So I was excited to go and eat there, usually in restaurants the food is way better than catered.  We went for dinner, was very surprised to find that you only get 4 ribs with the pork ribs, and the size of the sides were ridiculous.  The sides were not much bigger than the little cups that you get your salad dressing in at most places!  I had the brisket, it was ok at best!  Odd to have raw onions with it..... No texas toast or anything else, just 3 pieces of meat and to very small sides.  So dinner for two, rib meal, brisket meal, 2 sodas, and tip it was over $40 dollars.  Most likely wont be back, staff was alright, the one seemed new which is not a problem.  But as far as quality for value.......very poor.

Hn-54wIeyjf0f1dCfgoruQ.text: This place is lit. Dank food.  The grill master is the real deal. Tried 4 dishes are they are phenomenal . Must go

1cWmMhRf7IpU3_XtexCEXA.text: Quaint "hole-in-the-wall" restaurant with excellent food and service. My only complaint was the plastic utensils.

SI-kIuUPNVsgYYPC8GMmgw.text: Sin City Smokers was smokin' hot!  I used the Amazing Master Chef Steve's sinfully phenominal BBQ for a company meeting and received an overwhelming "5-star/2-thumbs way up!" review from the men.  This crew is not easily satisfied, so a resounding "Well Done" to Steve, his staff and Sin City Smokers.  You have created customers for life.

W2iFibZ1wbk4YlRG5X2fkg.text: I had the opportunity to experience Sin City Smokers tonight at Sitara Hookah Lounge and let.  Me.  Tell.  You.....beyond tasty.  I had their Bad Ass Barbeque Fries.  These fries were topped with some of the best tasting slow cooked brisket I've had in Vegas.  The combination of the siracha ranch and the spicy barbeque sauce just made the dish melt in my mouth.  You gotta check these guys out!!!!

4C5LACH5lBEFfZgZo-p3uw.text: This was, hands down the BEST brisket I've ever tasted--flavorful and juicy and tender. Also had the ribs which were very good also. The mac and cheese and dill coleslaw were very good, but my favorite side was actually the baked beans. Really sweet and that's the way I like them. We'll be back--In fact we almost went back the very next day.

r4oXRtaiB9y_WaAPAg5EFw.text: I found the bbq to be amazing.  I had the brisket on tacos, the meat was cooked to perfection smoked and tender. I had the killer fries, they were so many layers of favors with the beans,cheese and meat.  I will be back. Thanks for the great meal.

m1Q3_TqgeLZci8GuOVIOUQ.text: Tried several things on their menu- including the fries, chicken on a stick, and the meatballs. The service was great and so was the food. I would highly recommend trying Sin City Smokers delicious food!

WmvPYt_xST0q052MYC4GwA.text: Look no further for your next caterer.  Steve was great to work with and cooked up a GREAT meal for our event at a fair price!  I would definitely hire he and his team again!

23icie--iPen2-xjVFcXxQ.text: Make sure you get a side of the maple bacon baked beans, they are great.  Brisket and ribs are yummy too.  It's a bit hard to find, there is no sign, so you have to look at the glass in front of the shop to locate it.

SUo5hrCPr1g_wHmdsbnSXQ.text: I used Sin City Smokers for a last min catering company for a party we where getting ready to host,and boy did they knock it out of the park. Not only was the communication on point,but the food was amazing! I would highly recommend using them for any events you have coming up!  Thanks Steve and crew for your awesome service!

Mb1Dr2FhZ8V8lM-NwHVSnA.text: Absolutely amazing! We ordered this catering for our wedding reception and it was all the rage!! Their macaroni and cheese was to die for and the brisket was insanely good!! It was definitely the hit of the event and I'm not even mad about it!

MzuOZXYzgNzdZGPWkoqDjQ.text: As a connoisseur of fine BBQ you can understand why initially I was skeptical about using Sin City Smokers. After they came and set up for the party of 30+ people I still was a little concern. Steve was outstanding. The brisket was the best I ever had. The BBQ and the Chicken was outstanding. The people at the party were so impressed that they all asked for Sin City Smokers brochure. These guys are amazing. The questions that should be asked. Would you hire them again for any future parties? The answer is absolutely yes without question!!!!!!

WVheAKMGuJKF9mj-GqqUKg.text: Hired for an outdoor party and they were really great! Showed up on time and set up everything! All my guests and the birthday boy loved the food. They do everything and give you one less thing to worry about! Very reasonably priced and worth every penny!

rudtw8CfeFMaGE1wP7TyGA.text: Sin City Smokers makes the most amazing BBQ! The steaks and ribs were seasoned and cooked perfectly! Steve and Shirley were also super cool. Highly recommended!

grOUuDSgxsS730fRu0jzwA.text: I used Sin City Smokers for events ranging from community service for our fraternity, UNLV rebel tailgates, and even an event to showcase the UNLV campus to Administration and students from Singapore. Every person at every event loved the food and the atmosphere that the set up created. The staff and management were always there to answer any questions and the set-up and execution of the event was on fantastic, never had any worries, they were spot on. I would recommend Sin CIty Smokers for there professionalism and consistency and competitive prices. I now manage a Catering Company (Plaza Catering) in KC and Denver and can say that Sin CIty Smokers was and is a good one.

LrL80QW-7uEwYO783ViuaQ.text: Loved the bbq! Had the quesadilla and the fries! Keep it up guys - first time I tried your food and you guys definitely did not disappoint!

DoW2qoMQccWxiRJ11El-tg.text: We have used Sin City for the past 2 years with a company function and it has been a wonderful experience! Steve is so accommodating and willing to work with our budget and able to put my mind at ease with not having to worry about anything related to the food; the plates, the cutlery, even the table they set up on and trash cans! Their baked beans were amazing and their sausage and chicken were a crowd favorite. Definitely would recommend them.

5uHlRJxKPL_ltxZ3EokcVg.text: I really wanted to like this place. They are close by and they did are licensed unlike the bbq trailer set up in the lot next door. But this place is bad. First there was no air conditioning in dining area. The food is totally a la carte. Doesnt see bad at first but the total was high for a place like this. Brisket just the meat $9 I asked for it chopped and what I received seemed to be the pile left at end of chopping board. Black, fatty greasy mess. Couldn't even eat it. The sides at $2 each are limited and the creativity to the beans and potato salad did not pay off. They also come in little cups smaller than a Snack pac pudding. Very stingy for inexpensive items. Sauce was either spicy or too sweet. I asked for bread because it is not listed anywhere but it was nothing special. For two of us it came to $34.95.  Only one other customer and service was very slow. The girl serving us had long brown hair flying around with no net or hair the the health department requires. BBQ is limited in town but I will be driving out to the Texas joint on St Rose Parkway from now on. Too bad this area really needs good restaurants.

JCkdacnIIro5MW3TBM67bQ.text: I used Sin City Smokers for my outdoor park wedding. My entire experience was nothing short of amazing! If I could give them more than 5 stars I would! They served some of the best bbq I have EVER had! Their smackaroni and cheese is out of this world good!!! My guests were talking about how good food was for weeks afterwards.  Their customer service and attention to detail far exceeded all of my expectations!
